```tsx
import { useForm } from 'react-hook-form';
import { zodResolver } from '@hookform/resolvers/zod';
import { z } from 'zod';
import { useEffect } from 'react';

// Similar schema as in the creation example
const releaseSchema = z.object({
  title: z.string().min(2, { message: 'Title must be at least 2 characters' }),
  artist: z.string().min(2, { message: 'Artist name must be at least 2 characters' }),
  // Other fields...
});

type ReleaseFormValues = z.infer<typeof releaseSchema>;

function EditReleasePage() {
  const { id } = useParams();
  const releaseId = parseInt(id);
  const navigate = useNavigate();

  const { data: release, isLoading: isLoadingRelease } = useRelease(releaseId);
  const { mutate, isPending } = useUpdateRelease(releaseId);

  const form = useForm<ReleaseFormValues>({
    resolver: zodResolver(releaseSchema),
    // Default values will be populated once the data is loaded
    defaultValues: {
      title: '',
      artist: '',
      // Other fields...
    }
  });

  // Reset form with release data when it loads
  useEffect(() => {
    if (release) {
      form.reset({
        title: release.title,
        artist: release.artist,
        // Other fields...
      });
    }
  }, [release, form]);

  const onSubmit = (data: ReleaseFormValues) => {
    mutate(data, {
      onSuccess: () => {
        navigate(`/releases/${releaseId}`);
      }
    });
  };

  if (isLoadingRelease) {
    return <div>Loading...</div>;
  }

  return (
    <div>
      <h1>Edit Release</h1>

      <Form {...form}>
        <form onSubmit={form.handleSubmit(onSubmit)}>
          <FormField
            control={form.control}
            name="title"
            render={({ field }) => (
              <FormItem>
                <FormLabel>Title</FormLabel>
                <FormControl>
                  <Input {...field} />
                </FormControl>
                <FormMessage />
              </FormItem>
            )}
          />

          <FormField
            control={form.control}
            name="artist"
            render={({ field }) => (
              <FormItem>
                <FormLabel>Artist</FormLabel>
                <FormControl>
                  <Input {...field} />
                </FormControl>
                <FormMessage />
              </FormItem>
            )}
          />

          {/* Other form fields... */}

          <Button type="submit" disabled={isPending}>
            {isPending ? 'Saving...' : 'Save Changes'}
          </Button>
        </form>
      </Form>
    </div>
  );
}
```

### Deleting Data

#### Delete Button Component

```tsx
import { useDeleteRelease } from '@/hooks';
import { Button } from '@/components/ui/button';
import { useNavigate } from 'wouter';
import { Dialog, DialogContent, DialogHeader, DialogTitle, DialogDescription, DialogFooter } from '@/components/ui/dialog';
import { useState } from 'react';

interface DeleteReleaseButtonProps {
  releaseId: number;
  onSuccess?: () => void;
}

function DeleteReleaseButton({ releaseId, onSuccess }: DeleteReleaseButtonProps) {
  const [confirmOpen, setConfirmOpen] = useState(false);
  const navigate = useNavigate();

  const { mutate, isPending } = useDeleteRelease();

  const handleDelete = () => {
    mutate(`/api/releases/${releaseId}`, {
      onSuccess: () => {
        setConfirmOpen(false);

        if (onSuccess) {
          onSuccess();
        } else {
          navigate('/releases');
        }
      }
    });
  };

  return (
    <>
      <Button 
        variant="destructive" 
        onClick={() => setConfirmOpen(true)}
      >
        Delete Release
      </Button>

      <Dialog open={confirmOpen} onOpenChange={setConfirmOpen}>
        <DialogContent>
          <DialogHeader>
            <DialogTitle>Confirm Deletion</DialogTitle>
            <DialogDescription>
              Are you sure you want to delete this release? This action cannot be undone.
            </DialogDescription>
          </DialogHeader>
          <DialogFooter>
            <Button variant="outline" onClick={() => setConfirmOpen(false)}>
              Cancel
            </Button>
            <Button 
              variant="destructive" 
              onClick={handleDelete}
              disabled={isPending}
            >
              {isPending ? 'Deleting...' : 'Delete'}
            </Button>
          </DialogFooter>
        </DialogContent>
      </Dialog>
    </>
  );
}
```

### File Uploads

#### Upload Release Artwork

```tsx
import { useUploadReleaseArtwork } from '@/hooks';
import { Button } from '@/components/ui/button';
import { Input } from '@/components/ui/input';
import { Progress } from '@/components/ui/progress';
import { useState } from 'react';

interface ArtworkUploaderProps {
  releaseId: number;
  onSuccess: (artworkUrl: string) => void;
}

function ArtworkUploader({ releaseId, onSuccess }: ArtworkUploaderProps) {
  const [file, setFile] = useState<File | null>(null);
  const [uploadProgress, setUploadProgress] = useState(0);

  const { mutate, isPending } = useUploadReleaseArtwork(releaseId);

  const handleFileChange = (e: React.ChangeEvent<HTMLInputElement>) => {
    if (e.target.files && e.target.files[0]) {
      setFile(e.target.files[0]);
    }
  };

  const handleUpload = () => {
    if (!file) return;

    mutate({
      files: file,
      onProgress: (progress) => {
        setUploadProgress(progress);
      }
    }, {
      onSuccess: (data) => {
        onSuccess(data.url);
        setFile(null);
        setUploadProgress(0);
      }
    });
  };

  return (
    <div className="space-y-4">
      <div>
        <Input 
          type="file" 
          accept="image/*" 
          onChange={handleFileChange}
          disabled={isPending}
        />
      </div>

      {isPending && (
        <div className="space-y-2">
          <Progress value={uploadProgress} max={100} />
          <p className="text-sm text-gray-500">{uploadProgress}% uploaded</p>
        </div>
      )}

      <Button 
        onClick={handleUpload}
        disabled={!file || isPending}
      >
        {isPending ? 'Uploading...' : 'Upload Artwork'}
      </Button>
    </div>
  );
}
```

### Form Handling

#### Login Form with Error Handling

```tsx
import { useLogin } from '@/hooks';
import { useNavigate } from 'wouter';
import { Button } from '@/components/ui/button';
import { Form, FormField, FormItem, FormLabel, FormControl, FormMessage } from '@/components/ui/form';
import { Input } from '@/components/ui/input';
import { useForm } from 'react-hook-form';
import { zodResolver } from '@hookform/resolvers/zod';
import { z } from 'zod';
import { isValidationError, formatValidationErrors } from '@/utils';

const loginSchema = z.object({
  username: z.string().min(1, { message: 'Username is required' }),
  password: z.string().min(1, { message: 'Password is required' })
});

type LoginFormValues = z.infer<typeof loginSchema>;

function LoginPage() {
  const navigate = useNavigate();

  const form = useForm<LoginFormValues>({
    resolver: zodResolver(loginSchema),
    defaultValues: {
      username: '',
      password: ''
    }
  });

  const { mutate, isPending, error } = useLogin();

  // Handle API validation errors
  const apiValidationErrors = error && isValidationError(error) 
    ? formatValidationErrors(error) 
    : null;

  if (apiValidationErrors) {
    // Apply API validation errors to form
    Object.entries(apiValidationErrors).forEach(([field, error]) => {
      form.setError(field as any, { message: error.message });
    });
  }

  const onSubmit = (data: LoginFormValues) => {
    mutate(data, {
      onSuccess: () => {
        navigate('/dashboard');
      }
    });
  };

  return (
    <div>
      <h1>Login</h1>

      <Form {...form}>
        <form onSubmit={form.handleSubmit(onSubmit)}>
          <FormField
            control={form.control}
            name="username"
            render={({ field }) => (
              <FormItem>
                <FormLabel>Username</FormLabel>
                <FormControl>
                  <Input {...field} />
                </FormControl>
                <FormMessage />
              </FormItem>
            )}
          />

          <FormField
            control={form.control}
            name="password"
            render={({ field }) => (
              <FormItem>
                <FormLabel>Password</FormLabel>
                <FormControl>
                  <Input type="password" {...field} />
                </FormControl>
                <FormMessage />
              </FormItem>
            )}
          />

          <Button type="submit" disabled={isPending}>
            {isPending ? 'Logging in...' : 'Login'}
          </Button>
        </form>
      </Form>
    </div>
  );
}
```

### Error Handling

#### Error Boundary Component

```tsx
import { ApiError } from '@/services';
import { isAuthError, isNetworkError, formatErrorForDisplay } from '@/utils';
import { Button } from '@/components/ui/button';
import { useEffect, useState } from 'react';
import { useNavigate } from 'wouter';

interface ErrorFallbackProps {
  error: Error;
  resetErrorBoundary: () => void;
}

function ErrorFallback({ error, resetErrorBoundary }: ErrorFallbackProps) {
  const navigate = useNavigate();
  const [showDetails, setShowDetails] = useState(false);

  // Handle authentication errors
  useEffect(() => {
    if (isAuthError(error)) {
      // Redirect to login page after a short delay
      const timer = setTimeout(() => {
        navigate('/login');
      }, 3000);

      return () => clearTimeout(timer);
    }
  }, [error, navigate]);

  // Different UI for different error types
  if (isAuthError(error)) {
    return (
      <div className="error-container">
        <h2>Authentication Error</h2>
        <p>Your session has expired or you are not authorized to view this page.</p>
        <p>Redirecting to login page...</p>
        <Button onClick={() => navigate('/login')}>
          Login Now
        </Button>
      </div>
    );
  }

  if (isNetworkError(error)) {
    return (
      <div className="error-container">
        <h2>Network Error</h2>
        <p>Unable to connect to the server. Please check your internet connection.</p>
        <Button onClick={resetErrorBoundary}>
          Try Again
        </Button>
      </div>
    );
  }

  // Generic error UI
  return (
    <div className="error-container">
      <h2>Something went wrong</h2>
      <p>{formatErrorForDisplay(error)}</p>

      {error instanceof ApiError && error.details && (
        <>
          <Button variant="outline" onClick={() => setShowDetails(!showDetails)}>
            {showDetails ? 'Hide Details' : 'Show Details'}
          </Button>

          {showDetails && (
            <pre className="error-details">
              {JSON.stringify(error.details, null, 2)}
            </pre>
          )}
        </>
      )}

      <div className="error-actions">
        <Button onClick={resetErrorBoundary}>
          Try Again
        </Button>
        <Button variant="outline" onClick={() => navigate('/')}>
          Go to Home
        </Button>
      </div>
    </div>
  );
}
```

## Standardized Form Handling Guide

## Standardized Form Handling Guide

This document outlines the standardized form handling patterns implemented in our application.

### Table of Contents

1. [Overview](#overview)
2. [Form Hooks](#form-hooks)
3. [Error Handling](#error-handling)
4. [Usage Examples](#usage-examples)
5. [Best Practices](#best-practices)

### Overview

Our application uses a consistent approach to form handling based on React Hook Form and Zod validation. This standardized approach ensures:

- Type safety through the entire form lifecycle
- Consistent error handling
- Standardized user feedback
- Reusable form patterns

### Form Hooks

We provide several custom hooks to streamline form creation:

#### `useForm`

Basic form with Zod validation.

```tsx
const form = useForm(schema, defaultValues);
```

#### `useFormWithErrorHandling`

Enhanced form with standardized error handling.

```tsx
const form = useFormWithErrorHandling(schema, defaultValues);
// Use the handleSubmitWithErrorHandling method for automatic error toasts
<form onSubmit={form.handleSubmitWithErrorHandling(onSubmit)}>
```

#### `useCrudForm`

Complete form solution for CRUD operations, including API mutation integration.

```tsx
const {
  form,
  handleSubmit,
  handleSubmitWithErrorHandling,
  isPending,
  isSuccess,
  isError,
  error,
  reset
} = useCrudForm(schema, {
  apiEndpoint: '/api/resource',
  queryKey: ['resources'],
  defaultValues,
  onSuccessMessage: 'Resource created successfully!',
  // other options...
});
```

#### `useFileUploadForm`

Form hook specifically designed for file uploads.

```tsx
const {
  form,
  handleSubmit,
  handleSubmitWithErrorHandling
} = useFileUploadForm(schema, {
  apiEndpoint: '/api/upload',
  queryKey: ['uploads'],
  fileFieldName: 'file',
  // other options...
});
```

### Error Handling

The enhanced error handling pattern includes:

1. **Form Validation Errors**: Automatically displays toast notifications for validation errors
2. **API Errors**: Handles and displays error messages from API responses
3. **Success Feedback**: Shows success messages after successful form submission

### Usage Examples

#### Basic Form with Error Handling

```tsx
// Define schema with Zod
const userSchema = z.object({
  name: z.string().min(2, "Name must be at least 2 characters"),
  email: z.string().email("Invalid email address"),
});

// Use the form in your component
function UserForm() {
  const form = useFormWithErrorHandling(userSchema, {
    name: '',
    email: '',
  });

  const onSubmit = async (values) => {
    // Handle form submission
    await saveUser(values);
  };

  return (
    <Form {...form}>
      <form onSubmit={form.handleSubmitWithErrorHandling(onSubmit)}>
        {/* Form fields */}
      </form>
    </Form>
  );
}
```

#### CRUD Form Example

```tsx
function CreateResourceForm() {
  const {
    form,
    handleSubmitWithErrorHandling,
    isPending
  } = useCrudForm(resourceSchema, {
    apiEndpoint: '/api/resources',
    queryKey: ['resources'],
    defaultValues: { title: '', description: '' },
    onSuccessMessage: 'Resource created successfully!',
  });

  return (
    <Form {...form}>
      <form onSubmit={handleSubmitWithErrorHandling}>
        {/* Form fields */}
        <Button type="submit" disabled={isPending}>
          {isPending ? 'Creating...' : 'Create Resource'}
        </Button>
      </form>
    </Form>
  );
}
```

#### File Upload Form Example

```tsx
function UploadForm() {
  const {
    form,
    handleSubmitWithErrorHandling
  } = useFileUploadForm(uploadSchema, {
    apiEndpoint: '/api/uploads',
    queryKey: ['uploads'],
    fileFieldName: 'file',
    onSuccessMessage: 'File uploaded successfully!',
  });

  return (
    <Form {...form}>
      <form onSubmit={handleSubmitWithErrorHandling}>
        {/* Form fields including file input */}
        <Button type="submit">Upload</Button>
      </form>
    </Form>
  );
}
```

### Best Practices

1. **Always use Zod schemas** for validation
2. **Prefer `handleSubmitWithErrorHandling`** over standard `handleSubmit` for consistent error messages
3. **Provide default values** to avoid uncontrolled component warnings
4. **Use `isPending` state** to disable buttons during submission
5. **Include success/error states** in UI for better user feedback
6. **Reset forms after submission** when appropriate
7. **Invalidate relevant queries** after successful mutations
8. **Implement custom error messages** for specific validation rules

## Form Troubleshooting Guide

## Form Troubleshooting Guide

This guide helps troubleshoot common issues with forms using our enhanced form handling system.

### Common Issues

#### Type Errors

##### Issue: Typescript errors with form fields or handler functions

**Problem:**
```
Property 'handleSubmitWithErrorHandling' does not exist on type 'UseFormReturn<...>'
```

**Solution:**
Make sure you're using our enhanced form hooks instead of direct React Hook Form hooks:

```tsx
// Don't use this
import { useForm } from 'react-hook-form';
const form = useForm(...);

// Use this instead
import { useFormWithErrorHandling } from '@/hooks/use-react-hook-form';
const form = useFormWithErrorHandling(...);
```

##### Issue: Type mismatches between form values and schema

**Problem:**
```
Type 'string | undefined' is not assignable to type 'string'
```

**Solution:**
Make sure your Zod schema correctly represents optional fields:

```tsx
// Incorrect
const schema = z.object({
  optionalField: z.string(),  // This requires a string
});

// Correct
const schema = z.object({
  optionalField: z.string().optional(),  // This allows undefined
});
```

#### Validation Errors

##### Issue: Form submits with invalid data

**Problem:** The form is submitting even though validation should fail.

**Solution:**
1. Ensure you're using `handleSubmitWithErrorHandling` which includes validation checks
2. Check that your Zod schema has the correct validation rules
3. Make sure you're not accidentally bypassing validation in your submit handler

```tsx
// Use this pattern
<form onSubmit={form.handleSubmitWithErrorHandling(onSubmit)}>
```

##### Issue: Custom validation errors not showing

**Problem:** Your custom validation error messages aren't appearing in the UI.

**Solution:**
1. Check that you've included `<FormMessage />` in each form field
2. Make sure your schema has proper error messages:

```tsx
const schema = z.object({
  password: z.string()
    .min(8, "Password must be at least 8 characters")
    .regex(/[A-Z]/, "Password must contain at least one uppercase letter")
});
```

#### API Integration

##### Issue: API call not being made on submit

**Problem:** Form submits but the API call doesn't happen.

**Solution:**
When using `useCrudForm`, check:
1. The `apiEndpoint` is correct
2. You're using `handleSubmitWithErrorHandling` in your form
3. No validation errors are preventing submission

```tsx
const { handleSubmitWithErrorHandling } = useCrudForm(...);

<form onSubmit={handleSubmitWithErrorHandling}>
```

##### Issue: API errors not showing in the UI

**Problem:** API request fails but no error message appears.

**Solution:**
1. Make sure your API returns errors in a standardized format
2. When using `useCrudForm`, add an error handler:

```tsx
const {
  form,
  handleSubmitWithErrorHandling,
  isError,
  error
} = useCrudForm(schema, {
  apiEndpoint: '/api/resource',
  onError: (err) => console.error('API error:', err)
});

// Then in your UI:
{isError && (
  <Alert variant="destructive">
    <AlertTitle>Error</AlertTitle>
    <AlertDescription>{error?.message || "An error occurred"}</AlertDescription>
  </Alert>
)}
```

#### File Uploads

##### Issue: File upload not working

**Problem:** Files aren't being sent with the form submission.

**Solution:**
1. Use the special `useFileUploadForm` hook for file uploads
2. Make sure the `fileFieldName` matches your form field name
3. Ensure you're using `multipart/form-data` for the request

```tsx
const {
  form,
  handleSubmitWithErrorHandling
} = useFileUploadForm(schema, {
  apiEndpoint: '/api/upload',
  queryKey: ['uploads'],
  fileFieldName: 'file'  // This should match your form field name
});
```

##### Issue: Large file uploads failing

**Problem:** Large file uploads timeout or fail.

**Solution:**
1. Add a loading indicator
2. Consider implementing chunked uploads for very large files
3. Check server-side file size limits

```tsx
// Show loading state
{isPending && <ProgressIndicator />}
```

#### Form State Issues

##### Issue: Form doesn't reset after successful submission

**Problem:** Form values remain after successful submission.

**Solution:**
Add the `resetOnSuccess` option when using `useCrudForm`:

```tsx
const { form, handleSubmitWithErrorHandling } = useCrudForm(schema, {
  apiEndpoint: '/api/resource',
  resetOnSuccess: true  // Add this option
});
```

##### Issue: Nested form fields not updating correctly

**Problem:** Complex or nested form fields don't update as expected.

**Solution:**
When dealing with nested objects or arrays, use the correct field naming pattern:

```tsx
// For nested objects
<FormField
  control={form.control}
  name="address.street"  // Note the dot notation
  render={({ field }) => (
    <FormItem>
      <FormLabel>Street</FormLabel>
      <FormControl>
        <Input {...field} />
      </FormControl>
      <FormMessage />
    </FormItem>
  )}
/>

// For arrays
<FormField
  control={form.control}
  name={`items.${index}.name`}  // Note the array index
  render={({ field }) => (
    <FormItem>
      <FormLabel>Item Name</FormLabel>
      <FormControl>
        <Input {...field} />
      </FormControl>
      <FormMessage />
    </FormItem>
  )}
/>
```

#### Performance Issues

##### Issue: Form rerenders too frequently

**Problem:** Form causes excessive rerenders affecting performance.

**Solution:**
1. Use the `useWatch` hook for specific field updates instead of watching all fields
2. Implement memoization for expensive computations

```tsx
// Instead of watching all fields
const formValues = form.watch();

// Watch only specific fields
const specificField = useWatch({
  control: form.control,
  name: "specificField"
});

// Memoize computations
const computedValue = useMemo(() => {
  return expensiveComputation(specificField);
}, [specificField]);
```

### Debugging Techniques

#### Logging Form State

Add temporary console logs to debug form issues:

```tsx
// Log all form state
console.log('Form state:', form.formState);

// Log specific validation errors
console.log('Errors:', form.formState.errors);

// Log current values
console.log('Values:', form.getValues());
```

#### Manually Triggering Validation

Manually trigger validation for debugging:

```tsx
// Validate all fields
const isValid = await form.trigger();
console.log('Form valid:', isValid);

// Validate specific field
const isFieldValid = await form.trigger('email');
console.log('Email field valid:', isFieldValid);
```

#### Using React DevTools

Inspect form component state using React DevTools:

1. Open browser developer tools
2. Navigate to the React tab
3. Find your form component
4. Check the hooks section to see the form state

#### Error Boundary

Wrap complex forms in an error boundary to catch and display rendering errors:

```tsx
import { ErrorBoundary } from "@/components/error-boundary";

<ErrorBoundary fallback={<div>Something went wrong with the form.</div>}>
  <YourFormComponent />
</ErrorBoundary>
```

### Best Practices

1. **Always use TypeScript**: Define proper types for all form values and submit handlers
2. **Default Values**: Always provide default values for all form fields
3. **Error Handling**: Use the enhanced error handling pattern consistently
4. **Validation Feedback**: Show clear validation errors at the field level
5. **Submission States**: Show loading, success, and error states for form submissions
6. **Form Reset**: Reset forms after successful submission when appropriate
7. **Cache Invalidation**: Invalidate relevant query cache after successful mutations
8. **Accessibility**: Ensure form components are accessible with proper labels and ARIA attributes

For more help, refer to the [Form Handling Guide](./form-handling.md) and [Form Migration Guide](./form-migration-guide.md).

## Comprehensive Form Guide

## Comprehensive Form Guide

This document provides a complete guide to the form handling system used in TuneMantra.

### Table of Contents

1. [Form System Overview](#form-system-overview)
2. [Form Hooks](#form-hooks)
3. [Form Components](#form-components)
4. [Error Handling](#error-handling)
5. [Migration Guide](#migration-guide)
6. [Troubleshooting](#troubleshooting)
7. [Best Practices](#best-practices)

### Form System Overview

Our application uses a standardized form handling approach built on:

- **React Hook Form**: For form state management
- **Zod**: For schema validation
- **Custom Hooks**: Enhanced versions of React Hook Form hooks with improved error handling and API integration
- **UI Components**: Shadcn UI form components for consistent styling

This approach provides:
- Type safety through the entire form lifecycle
- Consistent error handling and user feedback
- Standardized API integration
- Reusable form patterns

### Form Hooks

#### `useForm`

Basic form with Zod validation.

```tsx
const form = useForm(schema, defaultValues);
```

#### `useFormWithErrorHandling`

Enhanced form with standardized error handling.

```tsx
const form = useFormWithErrorHandling(schema, defaultValues);
// Use the handleSubmitWithErrorHandling method for automatic error toasts
<form onSubmit={form.handleSubmitWithErrorHandling(onSubmit)}>
```

#### `useCrudForm`

Complete form solution for CRUD operations, including API mutation integration.

```tsx
const {
  form,
  handleSubmit,
  handleSubmitWithErrorHandling,
  isPending,
  isSuccess,
  isError,
  error,
  reset
} = useCrudForm(schema, {
  apiEndpoint: '/api/resource',
  queryKey: ['resources'],
  defaultValues,
  onSuccessMessage: 'Resource created successfully!',
  // other options...
});
```

#### `useFileUploadForm`

Form hook specifically designed for file uploads.

```tsx
const {
  form,
  handleSubmit,
  handleSubmitWithErrorHandling
} = useFileUploadForm(schema, {
  apiEndpoint: '/api/upload',
  queryKey: ['uploads'],
  fileFieldName: 'file',
  // other options...
});
```

### Form Components

Our form components are built on Shadcn UI and include:

```tsx
<Form {...form}>
  <form onSubmit={form.handleSubmitWithErrorHandling(onSubmit)}>
    <FormField
      control={form.control}
      name="fieldName"
      render={({ field }) => (
        <FormItem>
          <FormLabel>Field Label</FormLabel>
          <FormControl>
            <Input {...field} />
          </FormControl>
          <FormMessage />
        </FormItem>
      )}
    />
    <Button type="submit">Submit</Button>
  </form>
</Form>
```

### Error Handling

Our form system provides comprehensive error handling:

1. **Validation Errors**: Automatically displayed at the field level and as toast notifications
2. **API Errors**: Handled and displayed from API responses
3. **Success Feedback**: Toast notifications on successful submission

```tsx
{isPending && <LoadingSpinner />}

{isSuccess && (
  <Alert className="mb-4">
    <CheckCircle className="h-4 w-4" />
    <AlertTitle>Success!</AlertTitle>
    <AlertDescription>Your form has been submitted.</AlertDescription>
  </Alert>
)}

{isError && (
  <Alert className="mb-4" variant="destructive">
    <AlertCircle className="h-4 w-4" />
    <AlertTitle>Error</AlertTitle>
    <AlertDescription>{error?.message || "An error occurred"}</AlertDescription>
  </Alert>
)}
```

### Migration Guide

#### Step 1: Update Imports

**Before:**
```tsx
import { useForm } from "react-hook-form";
import { zodResolver } from "@hookform/resolvers/zod";
```

**After:**
```tsx
import { useCrudForm, useFormWithErrorHandling } from "@/hooks/use-react-hook-form";
```

#### Step 2: Replace Form Initialization

**Before:**
```tsx
const form = useForm<FormValues>({
  resolver: zodResolver(formSchema),
  defaultValues: {
    name: "",
    email: "",
  },
});
```

**After:**
For API-connected forms:
```tsx
const {
  form,
  handleSubmitWithErrorHandling,
  isPending,
  isSuccess,
  isError,
  error,
  reset
} = useCrudForm<typeof formSchema>(
  formSchema,
  {
    apiEndpoint: '/api/resources',
    queryKey: ['resources'],
    defaultValues: {
      name: "",
      email: "",
    },
    onSuccessMessage: 'Form submitted successfully!',
  }
);
```

For standalone forms:
```tsx
const form = useFormWithErrorHandling(formSchema, {
  name: "",
  email: "",
});
```

#### Step 3: Update Form Submission Handler

**Before:**
```tsx
const onSubmit = async (data: FormValues) => {
  try {
    await saveData(data);
    toast({
      title: "Success",
      description: "Form submitted successfully",
    });
  } catch (error) {
    toast({
      title: "Error",
      description: error.message,
      variant: "destructive",
    });
  }
};

<form onSubmit={form.handleSubmit(onSubmit)}>
```

**After:**
For API-connected forms:
```tsx
<form onSubmit={handleSubmitWithErrorHandling}>
```

For standalone forms with custom submit logic:
```tsx
const onSubmit = async (data: FormValues) => {
  // Just handle the success case logic
  await saveData(data);
  // Return value (optional)
  return { success: true, id: 123 };
};

<form onSubmit={form.handleSubmitWithErrorHandling(onSubmit)}>
```

### Troubleshooting

#### Type Errors

##### Issue: TypeScript errors with form fields or handler functions

**Problem:**
```
Property 'handleSubmitWithErrorHandling' does not exist on type 'UseFormReturn<...>'
```

**Solution:**
Make sure you're using our enhanced form hooks instead of direct React Hook Form hooks.

##### Issue: Type mismatches between form values and schema

**Problem:**
```
Type 'string | undefined' is not assignable to type 'string'
```

**Solution:**
Make sure your Zod schema correctly represents optional fields:

```tsx
// Incorrect
const schema = z.object({
  optionalField: z.string(),  // This requires a string
});

// Correct
const schema = z.object({
  optionalField: z.string().optional(),  // This allows undefined
});
```

#### Validation Errors

##### Issue: Form submits with invalid data

**Problem:** The form is submitting even though validation should fail.

**Solution:**
1. Ensure you're using `handleSubmitWithErrorHandling` which includes validation checks
2. Check that your Zod schema has the correct validation rules
3. Make sure you're not accidentally bypassing validation in your submit handler

#### API Integration

##### Issue: API call not being made on submit

**Problem:** Form submits but the API call doesn't happen.

**Solution:**
When using `useCrudForm`, check:
1. The `apiEndpoint` is correct
2. You're using `handleSubmitWithErrorHandling` in your form
3. No validation errors are preventing submission

##### Issue: API errors not showing in the UI

**Problem:** API request fails but no error message appears.

**Solution:**
1. Make sure your API returns errors in a standardized format
2. When using `useCrudForm`, add an error handler

#### File Uploads

##### Issue: File upload not working

**Problem:** Files aren't being sent with the form submission.

**Solution:**
1. Use the special `useFileUploadForm` hook for file uploads
2. Make sure the `fileFieldName` matches your form field name
3. Ensure you're using `multipart/form-data` for the request

#### Debugging Techniques

1. **Logging Form State**: Use console.logs to debug form state
   ```tsx

   console.log('Errors:', form.formState.errors);
   console.log('Values:', form.getValues());
   ```

2. **Manually Triggering Validation**: Trigger validation manually for debugging
   ```tsx

   console.log('Form valid:', isValid);
   ```

3. **Using React DevTools**: Inspect form component state using React DevTools

### Best Practices

2. **Default Values**: Always provide default values for all form fields
3. **Error Handling**: Use the enhanced error handling pattern consistently
4. **Validation Feedback**: Show clear validation errors at the field level

## Local Installation Guide for TuneMantra

## Local Installation Guide for TuneMantra

This guide will help you set up the TuneMantra music distribution platform on your local machine.

### Prerequisites

1. Node.js (version 18 or higher)
2. PostgreSQL database
3. Git

### Clone the Repository

```bash
git clone [your-repository-url]
cd tunemantra
```

### Environment Setup

1. Copy the example environment file:
   ```bash
   cp .env.example .env
   ```

2. Edit the `.env` file with your database credentials and other configurations.
   Especially important:
   ```
   DATABASE_URL=postgresql://postgres:your_password@localhost:5432/tunemantra
   ```

### Fixing Dependency Conflicts

Create a `.npmrc` file in the root directory with the following content:

```
legacy-peer-deps=true
node-linker=hoisted
```

### Installation

1. Install dependencies with the legacy peer deps flag:
   ```bash
   npm install --legacy-peer-deps
   ```

2. Install TSX globally (required for running TypeScript code directly):
   ```bash
   npm install -g tsx
   ```

3. Create necessary directories:
   ```bash
   mkdir -p uploads temp exports
   ```

### Updating package.json (Optional)

If you encounter issues with the `tsx` command not being found, update the scripts in `package.json`:

```json
"scripts": {
  "dev": "npx tsx server/index.ts",
  "build": "vite build",
  "start": "node dist/server.js",
  "check": "tsc",
  "db:push": "npx drizzle-kit push"
}
```

### Database Setup

1. Create a PostgreSQL database named `tunemantra`.

2. Run migrations to set up the database schema:
   ```bash
   npx drizzle-kit push
   ```

### Running the Application

Start the development server:
```bash
npm run dev
```

The application should be available at http://localhost:5000

### Troubleshooting Common Issues

#### Issue: 'tsx' is not recognized
Solution: Use `npx tsx` instead of just `tsx` in npm scripts, or install TSX globally:
```bash
npm install -g tsx
```

#### Issue: Dependency conflicts with react-navigation
Solution: Always install with the legacy-peer-deps flag:
```bash
npm install --legacy-peer-deps
```

#### Issue: Database connection errors
1. Verify your PostgreSQL server is running
2. Check the DATABASE_URL in your .env file
3. Make sure database name, user, and password are correct

#### Issue: Missing node_modules
If you see errors about missing modules even after installation:
```bash
rm -rf node_modules package-lock.json
npm install --legacy-peer-deps
```

### Need Help?

If you encounter issues not covered in this guide, please contact the development team.

## Type Safety Improvements

## Type Safety Improvements

This document outlines the type safety improvements implemented across the application.

### Overview

We've made significant improvements to the type safety of our codebase, particularly focusing on forms, API interactions, and error handling. These changes ensure better developer experience, fewer runtime errors, and more consistent user interfaces.

### Key Improvements

#### 1. Enhanced Form Handling

We've created a standardized form handling system with proper TypeScript typing:

- **Enhanced Form Interface**: Added `EnhancedForm` interface that extends React Hook Form's `UseFormReturn` type with our custom error handling methods
- **Type-Safe Form Submissions**: Improved typing for submit handlers with proper `SubmitHandler` and `SubmitErrorHandler` types
- **Zod Schema Integration**: Tightened the integration between Zod schemas and form types

#### 2. API Interaction Types

- **Response Type Safety**: Added generic typing for API responses
- **Error Handling**: Improved error typing for better error handling
- **Query Management**: Enhanced TanStack Query typing for better cache management

#### 3. Component Props

- **Prop Type Safety**: Improved typing for component props
- **Event Handlers**: Added proper typing for event handlers
- **Optional Chaining**: Enforced null checks and optional chaining to prevent runtime errors

### Implementation Details

#### Form Type Improvements

```typescript
// Before
function useForm(schema) {
  // Loosely typed implementation
}

// After
export interface EnhancedForm<TFieldValues extends FieldValues> extends UseFormReturn<TFieldValues> {
  handleSubmitWithErrorHandling: <TContext extends object = object>(
    onValid: (data: TFieldValues, context?: TContext) => unknown | Promise<unknown>,
  ) => (e?: BaseSyntheticEvent) => Promise<void>;
}

export function useFormWithErrorHandling<TSchema extends z.ZodType<any>>(
  schema: TSchema,
  defaultValues?: z.infer<TSchema>,
  options?: FormOptions
): EnhancedForm<z.infer<TSchema>> {
  // Type-safe implementation
}
```

#### API Response Types

```typescript
// Type-safe API responses
export interface ApiResponse<T> {
  success: boolean;
  data?: T;
  error?: string;
  message?: string;
}

// Type-safe mutation function
export function useApiMutation<TData, TError, TVariables>(
  endpoint: string,
  method: 'POST' | 'PUT' | 'PATCH' | 'DELETE',
  options?: MutationOptions<TData>
): UseMutationResult<TData, TError, TVariables>;
```

### Future Improvements

1. **Complete Interface Standardization**: Continue standardizing interfaces across the application
2. **Runtime Type Checking**: Add runtime type validation for API responses
3. **Type Generation**: Automate type generation from API schemas
4. **Error Boundary Types**: Improve typing for error boundaries and error handling

### Migration Guide

When updating existing components to use the new type system:

1. Replace direct React Hook Form usage with our enhanced hooks
2. Update form submissions to use the type-safe handlers
3. Update API calls to use the typed response handlers
4. Check and fix any TypeScript errors after migration

## TuneMantra Installation Guide (3)

## TuneMantra Installation Guide

**Last Updated:** March 22, 2025

### System Requirements

#### Server Requirements

- **CPU:** 4+ cores recommended for production environments
- **RAM:** Minimum 8GB, 16GB+ recommended for production
- **Storage:** 50GB minimum, with additional storage for uploaded audio files and artwork
- **Operating System:** Ubuntu 22.04 LTS or later, CentOS 8+, or any modern Linux distribution

#### Software Requirements

- **Node.js:** v18.0.0 or higher
- **PostgreSQL:** v14.0 or higher
- **Git:** v2.25.0 or higher
- **npm:** v9.0.0 or higher (usually bundled with Node.js)
- **pm2:** For production process management (optional but recommended)

### Development Environment Setup

#### 1. Clone the Repository

```bash
git clone https://github.com/tunemantra/distribution-platform.git
cd distribution-platform
```

#### 2. Install Dependencies

```bash
npm install
```

#### 3. Set Up Environment Variables

Copy the example environment file and customize it:

```bash
cp .env.example .env
```

Edit the `.env` file with your specific configuration:

```
## Base configuration
NODE_ENV=development
PORT=5000

## Database configuration
DATABASE_URL=postgresql://username:password@localhost:5432/tunemantra

## Authentication
SESSION_SECRET=your_secure_session_secret
ADMIN_REGISTRATION_CODE=your_secure_admin_code

## File uploads
MAX_UPLOAD_SIZE=100000000
UPLOAD_DIR=./uploads

## External services (if applicable)
SPOTIFY_CLIENT_ID=your_spotify_client_id
SPOTIFY_CLIENT_SECRET=your_spotify_client_secret
## Add other service credentials as needed
```

#### 4. Initialize the Database

```bash
## Create the database if it doesn't exist
psql -c "CREATE DATABASE tunemantra;"

## Push the schema to the database
npm run db:push
```

#### 5. Start the Development Server

```bash
npm run dev
```

The application will be accessible at `http://localhost:5000`.

### Production Deployment

#### 1. Prepare the Server

Update the server and install required packages:

```bash
sudo apt update
sudo apt upgrade -y
sudo apt install -y curl git build-essential postgresql postgresql-contrib nginx
```

#### 2. Install Node.js

```bash
curl -fsSL https://deb.nodesource.com/setup_18.x | sudo -E bash -
sudo apt install -y nodejs
```

#### 3. Create a Database

```bash
sudo -u postgres psql

postgres=# CREATE DATABASE tunemantra;
postgres=# CREATE USER tunemantra_user WITH ENCRYPTED PASSWORD 'your_secure_password';
postgres=# GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON DATABASE tunemantra TO tunemantra_user;
postgres=# \q
```

#### 4. Clone and Configure the Application

```bash
## Create application directory
sudo mkdir -p /var/www/tunemantra
sudo chown -R $USER:$USER /var/www/tunemantra

## Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/tunemantra/distribution-platform.git /var/www/tunemantra
cd /var/www/tunemantra

## Install dependencies
npm install --production

## Configure environment
cp .env.example .env
nano .env  # Edit with production values
```

Edit the `.env` file with production configuration:

```
NODE_ENV=production
PORT=5000
DATABASE_URL=postgresql://tunemantra_user:your_secure_password@localhost:5432/tunemantra
SESSION_SECRET=your_very_secure_session_secret
## Add other production settings
```

#### 5. Set Up the Database

```bash
npm run db:push
```

#### 6. Set Up PM2 for Process Management

```bash
sudo npm install -g pm2

## Start the application with PM2
pm2 start server/index.ts --name "tunemantra" -- --interpreter ./node_modules/.bin/tsx

## Configure PM2 to start on boot
pm2 startup
pm2 save
```

#### 7. Configure Nginx as a Reverse Proxy

Create an Nginx configuration file:

```bash
sudo nano /etc/nginx/sites-available/tunemantra
```

Add the following configuration:

```nginx
server {
    listen 80;
    server_name your-domain.com www.your-domain.com;

    location / {
        proxy_pass http://localhost:5000;
        proxy_http_version 1.1;
        proxy_set_header Upgrade $http_upgrade;
        proxy_set_header Connection 'upgrade';
        proxy_set_header Host $host;
        proxy_cache_bypass $http_upgrade;
        proxy_set_header X-Real-IP $remote_addr;
        proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;
        proxy_set_header X-Forwarded-Proto $scheme;
    }

## Configure file upload size limits
    client_max_body_size 100M;
}
```

Enable the site and restart Nginx:

```bash
sudo ln -s /etc/nginx/sites-available/tunemantra /etc/nginx/sites-enabled/
sudo nginx -t  # Test the configuration
sudo systemctl restart nginx
```

#### 8. Set Up SSL with Let's Encrypt

```bash
sudo apt install -y certbot python3-certbot-nginx
sudo certbot --nginx -d your-domain.com -d www.your-domain.com
```

#### 9. Set Up a Cron Job for Database Backups

Create a backup script:

```bash
sudo nano /var/www/tunemantra/backup.sh
```

Add the following content:

```bash
## !/bin/bash
TIMESTAMP=$(date +"%Y%m%d_%H%M%S")
BACKUP_DIR="/var/backups/tunemantra"
mkdir -p $BACKUP_DIR
pg_dump -U tunemantra_user tunemantra | gzip > "$BACKUP_DIR/tunemantra_$TIMESTAMP.sql.gz"
find $BACKUP_DIR -type f -name "*.sql.gz" -mtime +7 -delete  # Keep 7 days of backups
```

Make it executable and add to crontab:

```bash
sudo chmod +x /var/www/tunemantra/backup.sh
sudo crontab -e
```

Add the following line to run backups daily at 2 AM:

```
0 2 * * * /var/www/tunemantra/backup.sh
```

### Docker Deployment (Alternative)

TuneMantra can also be deployed using Docker for easier environment management.

#### 1. Install Docker and Docker Compose

Follow the [official Docker installation guide](https://docs.docker.com/engine/install/) for your platform.

#### 2. Create Docker Compose Configuration

Create a `docker-compose.yml` file in the project root:

```yaml
version: '3.8'

services:
  app:
    build: .
    restart: unless-stopped
    ports:
      - "5000:5000"
    depends_on:
      - db
    environment:
      - NODE_ENV=production
      - DATABASE_URL=postgresql://tunemantra_user:your_secure_password@db:5432/tunemantra
      - SESSION_SECRET=your_secure_session_secret
## Add other environment variables as needed
    volumes:
      - ./uploads:/app/uploads

  db:
    image: postgres:14
    restart: unless-stopped
    environment:
      - POSTGRES_USER=tunemantra_user
      - POSTGRES_PASSWORD=your_secure_password
      - POSTGRES_DB=tunemantra
    volumes:
      - postgres_data:/var/lib/postgresql/data

volumes:
  postgres_data:
```

#### 3. Create a Dockerfile

Create a `Dockerfile` in the project root:

```dockerfile
FROM node:18-slim

WORKDIR /app

COPY package*.json ./
RUN npm install --production

COPY . .

ENV NODE_ENV=production
ENV PORT=5000

RUN npm run build

EXPOSE 5000

CMD ["node", "dist/server/index.js"]
```

#### 4. Build and Run with Docker Compose

```bash
docker-compose up -d
```

### First-Time Setup

After installation, follow these steps to set up the system:

1. Access the application at `http://localhost:5000` (or your domain in production)
2. Register the first admin account using the admin registration code set in your `.env` file
3. Log in as the admin and configure:
   - Platform settings
   - Distribution platforms
   - Royalty rates
   - Payment gateways (if applicable)
   - Email notifications (if applicable)
4. Create additional user accounts as needed

### Common Issues and Troubleshooting

#### Database Connection Issues

If you encounter database connection problems:

1. Verify the PostgreSQL service is running: `sudo systemctl status postgresql`
2. Check the database connection string in your `.env` file
3. Ensure the database user has proper permissions
4. Check PostgreSQL logs: `sudo journalctl -u postgresql`

#### File Upload Issues

If file uploads are failing:

1. Check the permissions on the uploads directory: `ls -la ./uploads`
2. Ensure the directory is writable by the application user
3. Verify the `MAX_UPLOAD_SIZE` environment variable
4. Check Nginx client_max_body_size setting if using Nginx

#### Application Performance Issues

If the application is slow:

1. Check server resource usage: `top` or `htop`
2. Consider increasing the database connection pool size
3. Implement caching for frequently accessed data
4. Scale the application horizontally if needed

### Upgrading

To upgrade to a new version:

1. Backup the database: `pg_dump -U tunemantra_user tunemantra > backup.sql`
2. Pull the latest code: `git pull origin main`
3. Install any new dependencies: `npm install`
4. Apply database migrations: `npm run db:push`
5. Restart the application:
   - Development: `npm run dev`
   - Production with PM2: `pm2 restart tunemantra`
   - Docker: `docker-compose down && docker-compose up -d`

### Security Considerations

- Always use strong, unique passwords for database users and admin accounts
- Keep the server and all software components updated with security patches
- Enable a firewall and configure it to allow only necessary traffic
- Use HTTPS in production with proper SSL/TLS certificates
- Regularly audit user accounts and permission levels
- Implement rate limiting for API endpoints to prevent abuse
- Set up monitoring and alerting for suspicious activities

### Support and Additional Resources

For additional support:

- Check the [TuneMantra documentation](/docs/README.md)
- Join our community forum at [community.tunemantra.com](https://community.tunemantra.com)
- Email the support team at [support@tunemantra.com](mailto:support@tunemantra.com)
- Explore the developer API documentation at [api.tunemantra.com/docs](https://api.tunemantra.com/docs)

## Getting Started with TuneMantra (2)

## Getting Started with TuneMantra

**Last Updated:** March 23, 2025  
**Version:** 1.0

### Table of Contents

1. [Introduction](#1-introduction)
2. [Account Setup](#2-account-setup)
3. [Platform Overview](#3-platform-overview)
4. [Your First Release](#4-your-first-release)
5. [Distribution Basics](#5-distribution-basics)
6. [Royalty Setup](#6-royalty-setup)
7. [Analytics Introduction](#7-analytics-introduction)
8. [Mobile Access](#8-mobile-access)
9. [Support Resources](#9-support-resources)
10. [Next Steps](#10-next-steps)

### 1. Introduction

Welcome to TuneMantra! This guide will help you get started with our platform and walk you through the essential steps to begin distributing your music globally.

#### 1.1 What is TuneMantra?

TuneMantra is a comprehensive music distribution and rights management platform designed to empower artists, labels, and music businesses. Our platform enables you to:

- Distribute your music to 150+ global streaming platforms
- Track and collect royalties from all sources
- Analyze your music's performance with detailed analytics
- Manage your music catalog efficiently
- Protect your music rights and intellectual property
- Connect with your audience through powerful marketing tools

#### 1.2 How to Use This Guide

This guide is organized as a step-by-step walkthrough of the essential tasks to get started with TuneMantra:

1. First, we'll help you set up your account and configure your profile
2. Then, we'll explore the platform interface and key features
3. Next, we'll guide you through creating and distributing your first release
4. Finally, we'll introduce you to royalty management and analytics

Each section includes step-by-step instructions, screenshots, and tips to help you navigate the platform effectively.

### 2. Account Setup

#### 2.1 Registration

To create your TuneMantra account:

1. Visit [www.tunemantra.com](https://www.tunemantra.com) and click **Sign Up**
2. Choose your account type:
   - **Artist**: For individual musicians
   - **Label**: For record labels
   - **Manager**: For artist managers
3. Enter your information:
   - Email address
   - Create a password
   - Your name
   - Phone number (optional)
4. Read and accept the Terms of Service and Privacy Policy
5. Click **Create Account**
6. Verify your email address by clicking the link sent to your inbox

#### 2.2 Profile Setup

To complete your profile:

1. Log in to your account
2. Click your profile icon in the top-right corner
3. Select **Profile Settings**
4. Complete the following sections:
   - **Basic Information**:
     - Professional name/Label name
     - Profile picture
     - Bio/Description
   - **Contact Information**:
     - Address
     - Phone number
     - Website
   - **Social Media**:
     - Add links to your social media profiles
   - **Tax Information**:
     - Country of tax residence
     - Tax ID number (if applicable)
5. Click **Save Changes**

#### 2.3 Payment Setup

To set up your payment method:

1. Go to **Finance** â **Payment Methods**
2. Click **Add Payment Method**
3. Choose your preferred payment method:
   - Direct deposit/ACH
   - PayPal
   - Wire transfer
   - Digital wallet
4. Enter your payment details
5. Set this as your default payment method if desired
6. Click **Save Payment Method**

#### 2.4 Subscription Selection

To choose a subscription plan:

1. Go to **Settings** â **Subscription**
2. Review the available plans:
   - **Basic**: Limited releases, standard features
   - **Pro**: Unlimited releases, advanced features
   - **Label**: Multi-artist management, team access
3. Compare features and pricing
4. Select the plan that best suits your needs
5. Complete the payment process
6. Confirm your subscription

### 3. Platform Overview

#### 3.1 Dashboard

The dashboard is your command center:

1. **Navigation Menu**: Located on the left side, provides access to all platform features
2. **Overview Cards**: Display key metrics like total streams, revenue, and new followers
3. **Recent Activity**: Shows your latest releases, distributions, and royalty payments
4. **Quick Actions**: Common tasks like creating a new release or viewing analytics
5. **Notifications**: Alerts about important updates or actions needed
6. **News Feed**: Industry news and platform updates

#### 3.2 Main Sections

TuneMantra is organized into these main sections:

- **Catalog**: Manage your music releases and tracks
- **Distribution**: Control where and how your music is delivered
- **Royalties**: Track and manage your earnings
- **Analytics**: View detailed performance metrics
- **Marketing**: Promotional tools and resources
- **Rights**: Manage ownership and legal information
- **Finance**: Handle payments and financial reporting
- **Settings**: Configure your account preferences

#### 3.3 User Interface Tips

Navigate the platform efficiently with these tips:

- **Search**: Use the global search bar to quickly find releases, tracks, or features
- **Filters**: Narrow down lists with powerful filtering options
- **Bulk Actions**: Select multiple items to perform actions on them simultaneously
- **Sorting**: Click column headers to sort lists by different criteria
- **Help**: Click the question mark icon for contextual help
- **Breadcrumbs**: Use the path at the top of the page to navigate back
- **Keyboard Shortcuts**: Press `?` to view available keyboard shortcuts

#### 3.4 Account Settings

Configure your account settings:

1. Go to **Settings** â **Account**
2. Customize your preferences:
   - **Notifications**: Control email and in-app alerts
   - **Privacy**: Manage data sharing preferences
   - **Security**: Set up two-factor authentication
   - **Team Access**: Invite team members (Label plans only)
   - **API Access**: Generate API keys for developers
   - **Language**: Set your preferred language
   - **Display**: Choose light or dark mode

### 4. Your First Release

#### 4.1 Preparing Your Content

Before creating a release, prepare these assets:

- **Audio Files**: High-quality WAV or FLAC files
- **Cover Artwork**: 3000x3000 pixel JPG or PNG
- **Release Information**: Title, artist name, genre, release date
- **Track Details**: Titles, ISRCs (if you have them), explicit content flags
- **Credits**: Songwriter, producer, and other contributor information
- **UPC**: Universal Product Code (TuneMantra can generate this for you)

#### 4.2 Creating a Release

To create your first release:

1. From your dashboard, click **Create New Release**
2. Select the release type:
   - Single (1-2 tracks)
   - EP (3-6 tracks)
   - Album (7+ tracks)
3. Enter basic release information:
   - Release title
   - Primary artist name
   - Release date
   - Genre and subgenre
   - Language
4. Upload your cover artwork
5. Click **Continue**

#### 4.3 Adding Tracks

To add tracks to your release:

1. On the release page, click **Add Track**
2. Upload your audio file
3. Enter track details:
   - Track title
   - Track artists (primary and featured)
   - Songwriter information
   - Explicit content flag (yes/no)
   - Lyrics (optional)
   - ISRC code (TuneMantra can generate this for you)
4. Click **Save Track**
5. Repeat for all tracks in your release
6. Arrange the track order by dragging tracks into position

#### 4.4 Final Review

Before submitting your release:

1. Go to the **Review** tab of your release
2. Check all information for accuracy:
   - Spelling of titles and names
   - Release date
   - Cover artwork quality
   - Track list and order
   - Metadata completeness
3. Run the **Quality Check** to identify any issues
4. Fix any flagged problems
5. Preview how your release will appear on major platforms
6. Save your release as a draft or proceed to distribution

### 5. Distribution Basics

#### 5.1 Selecting Platforms

To choose where to distribute your music:

1. From your release page, go to the **Distribution** tab
2. View the list of available streaming platforms
3. Select platforms:
   - Use **Select All** for maximum reach
   - Or individually check platforms
   - Use platform filters to select by region or type
4. Configure platform-specific options when available
5. Click **Save Selection**

#### 5.2 Distribution Settings

Configure your distribution settings:

1. On the Distribution tab, go to **Settings**
2. Choose your distribution timing:
   - **Immediate**: Process as soon as possible
   - **Scheduled**: Select a specific date
   - **Pre-Save Campaign**: Set up pre-release marketing
3. Set your pricing tier (if applicable)
4. Configure territory availability
5. Set up release exclusivity if needed
6. Click **Save Settings**

#### 5.3 Submitting for Distribution

To distribute your release:

1. Review all information one final time
2. Check the distribution agreement checkbox
3. Click **Submit for Distribution**
4. Confirm your submission
5. View the confirmation screen with estimated timeline
6. Track your distribution status on the release page

#### 5.4 Tracking Distribution Progress

Monitor your distribution status:

1. Go to **Catalog** â **Releases**
2. Select your release
3. Go to the **Distribution** tab
4. View the status for each platform:
   - **Pending**: Awaiting processing
   - **Processing**: Being prepared for delivery
   - **Delivered**: Sent to the platform
   - **Live**: Available on the platform
   - **Failed**: Distribution encountered an error
5. Check the estimated go-live dates for each platform
6. Set up notifications for status changes

### 6. Royalty Setup

#### 6.1 Understanding Royalties

Before setting up royalties, understand these key concepts:

- **Royalty Splits**: How earnings are divided between contributors
- **Royalty Types**: Different categories of royalties (performance, mechanical, etc.)
- **Payment Thresholds**: Minimum amount required before payment is issued
- **Pay-through Dates**: When royalties are calculated and distributed
- **Tax Withholding**: Tax implications for royalty payments

#### 6.2 Setting Up Royalty Splits

To configure how royalties are divided:

1. Go to your release in the catalog
2. Click on the **Royalties** tab
3. Select **Manage Splits**
4. Add recipients:
   - Click **Add Recipient**
   - Enter name and contact information
   - Select role (songwriter, producer, etc.)
   - Assign percentage
5. Ensure splits total 100%
6. Specify whether splits apply to the entire release or specific tracks
7. Click **Save Splits**

#### 6.3 Inviting Collaborators

To invite collaborators to view their royalties:

1. From the Royalties tab, click **Invite Collaborators**
2. Enter email addresses for your team members
3. Select their permission level:
   - View only
   - View and report issues
   - Full access
4. Add a personalized message
5. Click **Send Invitations**
6. Manage invited users in **Settings** â **Team**

#### 6.4 Royalty Advances

To configure advances for team members (if applicable):

1. Go to **Finance** â **Advances**
2. Click **Create Advance**
3. Select the recipient
4. Enter the advance amount
5. Configure recoupment terms:
   - Recoupment percentage
   - Recoupment period
   - Exemptions (if any)
6. Upload any relevant documentation
7. Click **Create Advance**

### 7. Analytics Introduction

#### 7.1 Analytics Dashboard

To access your analytics:

1. Click on **Analytics** in the main navigation
2. View your analytics dashboard with key metrics:
   - Total streams
   - Revenue generated
   - Listener demographics
   - Geographic distribution
   - Platform breakdown
   - Growth trends

#### 7.2 Understanding Key Metrics

Familiarize yourself with these important metrics:

- **Stream Count**: Number of times your music has been played
- **Stream Growth**: Change in streaming activity over time
- **Revenue**: Income generated from your music
- **Engagement**: Metrics like save rate, completion rate, and playlist adds
- **Audience**: Information about who is listening to your music
- **Performance Ranking**: How your music compares to similar artists

#### 7.3 Basic Reports

Generate basic analytics reports:

1. Go to **Analytics** â **Reports**
2. Select a report type:
   - **Performance Summary**: Overall metrics for a time period
   - **Track Comparison**: Compare different tracks' performance
   - **Platform Analysis**: Performance across different platforms
   - **Geographic Report**: Listener location data
   - **Trend Analysis**: Changes over time
3. Set the date range
4. Click **Generate Report**
5. View online or download in your preferred format

#### 7.4 Setting Goals

Set performance goals to track your progress:

1. Go to **Analytics** â **Goals**
2. Click **Set New Goal**
3. Choose a goal type:
   - Stream count
   - Revenue target
   - Audience growth
   - Geographic expansion
4. Enter your target number
5. Set a deadline
6. Click **Save Goal**
7. Track progress from your analytics dashboard

### 8. Mobile Access

#### 8.1 Mobile App

Access TuneMantra on your mobile device:

1. Download the TuneMantra app:
   - iOS: [App Store Link]
   - Android: [Google Play Link]
2. Log in with your account credentials
3. Enable biometric login for easier access
4. Configure push notifications
5. Explore the mobile interface

#### 8.2 Mobile Features

Key features available on mobile:

- **Real-time Analytics**: Check your performance on the go
- **Release Status**: Monitor distribution progress
- **Royalty Tracking**: View earnings and payments
- **Quick Actions**: Approve releases or respond to issues
- **Notifications**: Stay updated about important events
- **Document Scanning**: Upload contracts or other documents
- **Offline Mode**: View cached data without internet connection

#### 8.3 Mobile Settings

Optimize the mobile app for your needs:

1. Go to **Settings** in the mobile app
2. Configure:
   - **Data Usage**: Control cellular data consumption
   - **Notifications**: Set which alerts you receive on mobile
   - **Display**: Adjust text size and theme
   - **Biometric Security**: Enable Face ID or fingerprint login
   - **Offline Access**: Choose what data to cache
3. Save your preferences

### 9. Support Resources

#### 9.1 Help Center

Access comprehensive documentation:

1. Click the **Help** icon in the top-right corner
2. Browse help categories:
   - Getting Started
   - Catalog Management
   - Distribution
   - Royalties
   - Analytics
   - Technical Issues
3. Use the search bar to find specific topics
4. View step-by-step tutorials and FAQ sections

#### 9.2 Video Tutorials

Watch instructional videos:

1. Go to **Help** â **Video Tutorials**
2. Browse video categories
3. Watch tutorials for visual guidance on platform features
4. Videos include closed captions and transcripts
5. Bookmark favorites for easy reference

#### 9.3 Live Support

Get real-time assistance:

1. Click the **Chat** icon in the bottom-right corner
2. Start a conversation with our support team
3. Live support hours: Monday-Friday, 9am-8pm EST
4. Outside of those hours, submit a ticket for next-day response
5. For urgent issues, use the emergency contact feature

#### 9.4 Community Forum

Connect with other TuneMantra users:

1. Go to **Help** â **Community**
2. Browse discussion categories
3. Search for topics of interest
4. Ask questions to the community
5. Share your experiences and best practices
6. Connect with other artists and labels

### 10. Next Steps

#### 10.1 Expanding Your Catalog

Once your first release is live:

1. Plan your release schedule
2. Prepare your next release
3. Consider different release strategies:
   - Singles vs. albums
   - Release frequency
   - Exclusive content
4. Use analytics to inform your strategy

#### 10.2 Marketing Your Music

Promote your music effectively:

1. Go to **Marketing** â **Tools**
2. Explore marketing features:
   - Pre-save campaigns
   - Social media assets
   - Promotional links
   - Embed players
   - QR codes

## TuneMantra Quick Start Guide

## TuneMantra Quick Start Guide

This guide will help you get started with TuneMantra in just a few steps. Follow this guide to set up your account, upload your first release, and start distributing your music.

### Step 1: Create Your Account

1. Visit [tunemantra.com](https://tunemantra.com) and click "Sign Up"
2. Enter your email address and create a secure password
3. Verify your email address by clicking the link sent to your inbox
4. Complete your basic profile information:
   - Name
   - Artist/Label name
   - Country
   - Contact information

### Step 2: Select Your Subscription

1. Review the available subscription plans:
   - **Artist Basic**: Individual artist with up to 2 releases per year
   - **Artist Pro**: Individual artist with unlimited releases
   - **Label Basic**: Independent label with up to 25 artists
   - **Label Pro**: Established label with up to 100 artists
   - **Enterprise**: Custom solution for major labels

2. Select the plan that best fits your needs
3. Complete the payment process
4. Your subscription will be activated immediately

### Step 3: Complete KYC Verification

1. Navigate to "Account" â "Verification"
2. Upload the required documents:
   - Government-issued ID (passport, driver's license, etc.)
   - Proof of address (utility bill, bank statement, etc.)
   - Additional documents based on your country and account type
3. Wait for verification (typically 1-2 business days)
4. Once verified, you'll receive a confirmation email

### Step 4: Set Up Your Profile

1. Navigate to "Profile" â "Edit Profile"
2. Complete all required fields:
   - Profile picture (minimum 1000x1000px)
   - Biography (100-500 words)
   - Website and social media links
   - Genre specialization
3. For labels: Add your logo and company information
4. Save your changes

### Step 5: Upload Your First Release

1. Navigate to "Distribution" â "New Release"
2. Select the release type:
   - Single (1-3 tracks)
   - EP (4-6 tracks)
   - Album (7+ tracks)
3. Enter basic release information:
   - Release title
   - Primary artist
   - Release date (minimum 7 days from submission)
   - Genre
4. Upload your cover artwork:
   - Square image, minimum 3000x3000px
   - JPG or PNG format
   - No text near edges
5. Upload your audio files:
   - WAV format (16-bit, 44.1kHz minimum)
   - Properly labeled with track numbers and titles
6. Complete track metadata for each track:
   - Track title
   - Featured artists (if any)
   - Composers and lyricists
   - ISRC code (if you have one, or TuneMantra will generate one)
   - Explicit content flag (if applicable)
7. Review platform selection:
   - By default, all 150+ platforms are selected
   - Uncheck any platforms you want to exclude
8. Review your submission

### Step 6: Submit for Distribution

1. On the review page, carefully check all information
2. Accept the terms and conditions
3. Click "Submit for Distribution"
4. You'll receive a confirmation email with your release ID

### Step 7: Track Your Release

1. Navigate to "Distribution" â "My Releases"
2. Find your release in the list
3. Check the distribution status:
   - **Pending**: Initial submission
   - **Processing**: Being prepared for delivery
   - **Delivered**: Sent to platforms
   - **Live**: Available on platforms
4. Click on the release to view detailed platform status

### Step 8: Monitor Performance

1. Navigate to "Analytics" â "Overview"
2. Select your release from the dropdown
3. View key performance metrics:
   - Streams and downloads
   - Revenue generated
   - Geographic distribution
   - Platform breakdown
4. Export reports as needed

### Step 9: Set Up Payment Method

1. Navigate to "Earnings" â "Payment Methods"
2. Add your preferred payment method:
   - Bank account (recommended)
   - PayPal
   - Other available options based on your country
3. Complete all required banking information
4. Set your default payment method

### Step 10: Explore Additional Features

Now that you've completed the basic setup, explore these additional features:

1. **Royalty Splits**: Set up revenue sharing with collaborators
2. **Pre-Save Campaigns**: Create pre-release promotion
3. **Smart Links**: Create one link for all platforms
4. **Promotional Tools**: Access marketing resources
5. **Support Center**: Get help when you need it

### Troubleshooting

If you encounter any issues during the setup process:

1. Check the [Help Center](https://help.tunemantra.com) for guides and FAQs
2. Contact support through the "Support" tab in your dashboard
3. Email support@tunemantra.com with your account details and issue description

### Next Steps

Congratulations! You've completed the quick start guide. For more detailed information, check out these resources:

- [Complete Artist Guide](../guides/artist-guide.md)
- [Complete Label Guide](../guides/label-guide.md)
