- **Custom Templates**: User-created specialized templates

### Database Structure

The Import/Export Hub uses a dedicated database schema:

```sql
-- Import Jobs
CREATE TABLE import_jobs (
  id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  job_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
  source_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, -- 'file', 'api', 'sftp', etc.
  format VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, -- 'csv', 'json', 'excel', 'ddex', etc.
  template_id INTEGER, -- Reference to template
  created_by INTEGER NOT NULL, -- User who created the job
  status VARCHAR(30) DEFAULT 'pending', -- 'pending', 'processing', 'completed', 'failed', 'cancelled'
  priority VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'normal', -- 'low', 'normal', 'high', 'urgent'
  source_location TEXT, -- File path, API endpoint, etc.
  source_credentials JSONB, -- Encrypted credentials if needed
  options JSONB, -- Import options
  started_at TIMESTAMP,
  completed_at TIMESTAMP,
  error_details TEXT,
  row_count INTEGER,
  success_count INTEGER,
  error_count INTEGER,
  warning_count INTEGER,
  created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW(),
  updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW()
);

-- Import Batches (subdivisions of jobs)
CREATE TABLE import_batches (
  id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  job_id INTEGER REFERENCES import_jobs(id),
  batch_number INTEGER NOT NULL,
  status VARCHAR(30) DEFAULT 'pending',
  row_start INTEGER,
  row_end INTEGER,
  success_count INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
  error_count INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
  warning_count INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
  processing_time INTEGER, -- In milliseconds
  started_at TIMESTAMP,
  completed_at TIMESTAMP,
  created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW(),
  updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW()
);

-- Import Records (individual import items)
CREATE TABLE import_records (
  id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  batch_id INTEGER REFERENCES import_batches(id),
  record_index INTEGER NOT NULL, -- Original row/record number
  status VARCHAR(30) DEFAULT 'pending', -- 'pending', 'success', 'error', 'warning', 'skipped'
  record_type VARCHAR(50), -- 'track', 'release', 'artist', 'rights', etc.
  original_data JSONB, -- Original data before transformation
  transformed_data JSONB, -- Data after transformation
  validation_results JSONB, -- Validation results
  error_details TEXT,
  entity_id INTEGER, -- ID of created/updated entity
  created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW()
);

-- Export Jobs
CREATE TABLE export_jobs (
  id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  job_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
  destination_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, -- 'file', 'api', 'sftp', 'email', etc.
  format VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, -- 'csv', 'json', 'excel', 'ddex', etc.
  template_id INTEGER, -- Reference to template
  created_by INTEGER NOT NULL, -- User who created the job
  status VARCHAR(30) DEFAULT 'pending', -- 'pending', 'processing', 'completed', 'failed', 'cancelled'
  priority VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'normal', -- 'low', 'normal', 'high', 'urgent'
  query_criteria JSONB, -- Selection criteria
  destination_location TEXT, -- File path, API endpoint, etc.
  destination_credentials JSONB, -- Encrypted credentials if needed
  options JSONB, -- Export options
  started_at TIMESTAMP,
  completed_at TIMESTAMP,
  error_details TEXT,
  record_count INTEGER,
  file_size BIGINT, -- Size in bytes
  download_url VARCHAR(500), -- URL for download if applicable
  expiry_time TIMESTAMP, -- Expiry time for download
  created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW(),
  updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW()
);

-- Export Records (tracking of exported entities)
CREATE TABLE export_records (
  id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  job_id INTEGER REFERENCES export_jobs(id),
  entity_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, -- 'track', 'release', 'artist', 'rights', etc.
  entity_id INTEGER NOT NULL, -- ID of the exported entity
  status VARCHAR(30) DEFAULT 'pending',
  error_details TEXT,
  created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW()
);

-- Import/Export Templates
CREATE TABLE import_export_templates (
  id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
  description TEXT,
  type VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL, -- 'import', 'export'
  format VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, -- 'csv', 'json', 'excel', etc.
  entity_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, -- 'track', 'release', 'artist', 'rights', etc.
  is_system_template BOOLEAN DEFAULT false, -- System-provided vs user-created
  is_public BOOLEAN DEFAULT false, -- Available to all users
  created_by INTEGER NOT NULL,
  organization_id INTEGER, -- Organization that owns this template
  template_definition JSONB NOT NULL, -- Template configuration
  version INTEGER DEFAULT 1,
  is_active BOOLEAN DEFAULT true,
  usage_count INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
  last_used_at TIMESTAMP,
  created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW(),
  updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW()
);

-- Scheduled Import/Export Jobs
CREATE TABLE scheduled_jobs (
  id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
  job_type VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL, -- 'import', 'export'
  template_id INTEGER REFERENCES import_export_templates(id),
  schedule_type VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL, -- 'one-time', 'recurring'
  cron_expression VARCHAR(100), -- For recurring jobs
  scheduled_time TIMESTAMP, -- For one-time jobs
  last_run_time TIMESTAMP,
  next_run_time TIMESTAMP,
  status VARCHAR(30) DEFAULT 'active', -- 'active', 'paused', 'completed', 'error'
  source_destination JSONB, -- Source or destination details
  parameters JSONB, -- Job parameters
  created_by INTEGER NOT NULL,
  created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW(),
  updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW()
);

-- File Storage Locations
CREATE TABLE file_storage_locations (
  id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
  location_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL, -- 'local', 's3', 'ftp', 'sftp', etc.
  base_path TEXT NOT NULL,
  credentials JSONB, -- Encrypted credentials
  connection_options JSONB, -- Connection parameters
  is_active BOOLEAN DEFAULT true,
  created_by INTEGER NOT NULL,
  created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW(),
  updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW()
);

-- Format Configurations
CREATE TABLE format_configurations (
  id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  format_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL UNIQUE,
  format_type VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL, -- 'structured', 'audio', 'industry'
  direction VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL, -- 'import', 'export', 'both'
  handler_class VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL, -- Class that handles this format
  validator_class VARCHAR(255), -- Class for validation
  transformer_class VARCHAR(255), -- Class for transformation
  default_options JSONB, -- Default options for this format
  is_active BOOLEAN DEFAULT true,
  created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW(),
  updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW()
);
```

## TuneMantra Comprehensive Branch Documentation (2)

## TuneMantra Comprehensive Branch Documentation

This document provides exhaustive documentation for all branches in the TuneMantra repository. Each branch represents specific features, fixes, or improvements across the entire platform ecosystem, including backend services, frontend applications, mobile applications, and auxiliary systems.

### Table of Contents

1. [Branch Naming Conventions](#branch-naming-conventions)
2. [Main Development Branches](#main-development-branches)
3. [Feature Branches](#feature-branches)
4. [Release Branches](#release-branches)
5. [Bugfix Branches](#bugfix-branches)
6. [Experimental Branches](#experimental-branches)
7. [Cross-References to Features](#cross-references-to-features)
8. [Branch Merge History](#branch-merge-history)
9. [Branch Management Guidelines](#branch-management-guidelines)

### Branch Naming Conventions

TuneMantra follows consistent branch naming conventions across the repository to maintain organization and clarity:

- **Main Development Branches**: `develop`, `mobile-develop`, `pwa-develop`
- **Feature Branches**: `feature/feature-name`, `mobile/feature-name`, `frontend/feature-name`, `backend/feature-name`
- **Release Branches**: `release/vX.Y.Z`, `mobile-release/vX.Y.Z`
- **Bugfix Branches**: `fix/issue-description`, `mobile/fix-issue-description`
- **Experimental Branches**: `experimental/feature-name`, `mobile/experimental-feature-name`
- **Performance Branches**: `perf/optimization-area`, `mobile/perf-optimization-area`
- **Refactoring Branches**: `refactor/component-name`, `mobile/refactor-component-name`
- **AI Integration Branches**: `ai/feature-name`
- **Blockchain Branches**: `blockchain/feature-name`

### Main Development Branches

These are the primary long-running branches for TuneMantra development:

#### develop

**Purpose**: Main development branch for the core platform
**Status**: Active
**Created**: 2023-06-05
**Key Contributor**: Arnav Raj

**Description**:
This is the primary development branch for the TuneMantra platform. All feature branches are merged into this branch after code review and testing. This branch serves as the integration point for all development work before being promoted to release branches.

**Protected Status**:
- Requires pull request reviews (minimum 2 approvals)
- Requires passing CI/CD pipeline
- Prevents force pushes
- Requires up-to-date branches before merging

**Branch Policies**:
- All code must pass test suite
- Code coverage must not decrease
- Performance benchmarks must not regress
- Documentation must be updated
- Security scan must pass

#### mobile-develop

**Purpose**: Main development branch for mobile application features
**Status**: Active
**Created**: 2023-11-15
**Key Contributor**: Arnav Raj

**Description**:
This is the development branch dedicated to the mobile applications (iOS, Android, PWA). It maintains a separate lineage to allow for mobile-specific development cycles and release schedules, while still coordinating with the main platform development.

**Protected Status**:
- Requires pull request reviews (minimum 2 approvals)
- Requires passing mobile-specific CI tests
- Prevents force pushes
- Requires up-to-date branches before merging

**Branch Policies**:
- All code must pass mobile-specific test suite
- Performance benchmarks must not regress
- UI changes require design review
- API changes require documentation updates

#### frontend-develop

**Purpose**: Main development branch for frontend application
**Status**: Active
**Created**: 2023-07-10
**Key Contributor**: Arnav Raj, Michael Thompson

**Description**:
This branch contains all frontend development for the TuneMantra web application. It allows for independent development of the user interface and experience while coordinating with API developments in the backend branch.

**Protected Status**:
- Requires pull request reviews (minimum 1 approval)
- Requires passing frontend test suite
- Prevents force pushes
- Requires up-to-date branches before merging

**Branch Policies**:
- All code must pass accessibility checks
- Design system components must be used
- Performance metrics must meet targets
- Browser compatibility must be maintained

#### backend-develop

**Purpose**: Main development branch for backend services
**Status**: Active
**Created**: 2023-06-10
**Key Contributor**: Arnav Raj, Emily Zhang

**Description**:
This branch contains all backend service development, including API endpoints, database interactions, business logic, and infrastructure code. It maintains the server-side components of the TuneMantra platform.

**Protected Status**:
- Requires pull request reviews (minimum 2 approvals)
- Requires passing backend test suite
- Prevents force pushes
- Requires up-to-date branches before merging

**Branch Policies**:
- All code must pass backend test suite
- API changes require documentation updates
- Database migrations must be reversible
- Security scan must pass

#### ai-develop

This specialized branch contains all AI-related feature development, including machine learning models, recommendation systems, metadata enhancement, and content classification algorithms. It allows for specialized development of AI capabilities that are integrated into the main platform.

**Branch Policies**:

### Bugfix Branches

These branches represent specific bug fixes for the TuneMantra platform:

#### fix/rights-calculation-precision

**Purpose**: Fix precision errors in rights calculations
**Status**: Merged into `develop` on 2023-09-05
**Created**: 2023-09-02
**Created By**: Arnav Raj
**Primary Developer**: Arnav Raj

**Description**:
This branch fixed critical precision errors in royalty calculations that could result in incorrect distributions when dealing with multiple levels of splits and very small percentages. The fix implemented arbitrary-precision decimal handling for all financial calculations.

**Root Cause**:
Floating-point precision errors were occurring during complex nested calculations with many decimal places, leading to small but significant errors in final distribution amounts.

**Fix Implementation**:
- Replaced floating-point calculations with arbitrary-precision decimal library
- Implemented proper rounding strategies for financial calculations
- Added validation to ensure splits always total exactly 100%
- Improved test coverage for edge cases

**Affected Components**:
- Rights calculation engine
- Distribution service
- Financial reporting
- Split editor validation

**Testing Verification**:
- Comprehensive test suite with extreme edge cases
- Verified calculations against manual calculations
- Regression testing of previous calculation scenarios
- Performance impact assessment showing minimal overhead

#### fix/oauth-token-refresh

**Purpose**: Fix authentication issues with OAuth token refresh
**Status**: Merged into `develop` on 2023-10-10
**Created**: 2023-10-08
**Created By**: Arnav Raj
**Primary Developer**: Arnav Raj

**Description**:
This branch fixed an issue where OAuth token refresh would fail under certain conditions, causing users to be unexpectedly logged out and requiring re-authentication.

**Root Cause**:
Race conditions could occur during token refresh if multiple requests attempted refresh simultaneously, and refresh token lifetime was not properly monitored, leading to expired refresh tokens being used.

**Fix Implementation**:
- Implemented mutex locking for token refresh operations
- Added proactive refresh before expiration
- Enhanced error handling for refresh failures
- Improved logging and monitoring
- Added refresh token rotation

**Affected Components**:
- Authentication service
- API client library
- Session management
- User experience flow

**Testing Verification**:
- Simulated concurrent refresh attempts
- Tested with accelerated token expiration
- Verified proper error recovery
- Load testing under high concurrency

#### fix/database-connection-leaks

**Purpose**: Fix database connection leaks
**Status**: Merged into `backend-develop` on 2023-11-20
**Created**: 2023-11-18
**Created By**: Arnav Raj
**Primary Developer**: Arnav Raj, Emily Zhang

**Description**:
This branch fixed critical database connection leaks that were occurring in long-running processes and under error conditions, eventually leading to connection pool exhaustion and service degradation.

**Root Cause**:
Several code paths were not properly closing database connections in error scenarios, and some asynchronous operations were not handling promises correctly, leading to abandoned connections.

**Fix Implementation**:
- Implemented proper connection release in finally blocks
- Added connection timeout handling
- Improved error handling in async operations
- Created connection monitoring and automatic recovery
- Added alerting for connection pool health

**Affected Components**:
- Database access layer
- Query execution services
- Background job processors
- Connection pool management

**Testing Verification**:
- Long-running stress tests
- Induced failure scenarios
- Connection monitoring during high load
- Verified pool statistics after extended operation

#### fix/blockchain-transaction-timeout

**Purpose**: Fix timeout issues in blockchain transactions
**Status**: Merged into `blockchain-develop` on 2023-12-10
**Created**: 2023-12-07
**Created By**: Arnav Raj
**Primary Developer**: Arnav Raj

**Description**:
This branch fixed issues where blockchain transactions would time out during periods of network congestion or high gas prices, resulting in incomplete operations and inconsistent state.

**Root Cause**:
Transaction timeout values were too low for periods of network congestion, and the system did not properly handle transaction resubmission with higher gas prices when needed.

**Fix Implementation**:
- Implemented dynamic timeout based on network conditions
- Added automatic gas price adjustment
- Created transaction monitoring and resubmission
- Improved transaction queueing and prioritization
- Enhanced state reconciliation for failed transactions

**Affected Components**:
- Blockchain integration service
- Transaction submission system
- Smart contract interaction
- State reconciliation service

**Testing Verification**:
- Simulated network congestion scenarios
- Tested with varying gas price conditions
- Verified proper transaction completion under stress
- Measured success rate improvement

#### mobile/fix-offline-sync-conflict

**Purpose**: Fix data loss during conflict resolution
**Status**: Merged into `mobile-develop` on 2024-01-20
**Created**: 2024-01-18
**Created By**: Arnav Raj
**Primary Developer**: Arnav Raj

**Description**:
This branch fixed a critical issue where data could be lost during conflict resolution when synchronizing offline changes. The issue occurred when multiple users modified the same entity simultaneously, resulting in incorrect merge decisions.

**Root Cause**:
The conflict resolution algorithm was not properly considering timestamp precision, leading to incorrect "most recent change" determinations in some edge cases.

**Fix Implementation**:
- Enhanced timestamp comparison logic
- Added conflict detection for nested objects
- Implemented proper three-way merge for complex objects
- Added additional logging for conflict resolution decisions

**Affected Components**:
- Synchronization engine
- Conflict resolution system
- Local storage manager

**Testing Verification**:
- Reproduced the issue in automated tests
- Verified fix with 25 different conflict scenarios
- Validated with real-world data patterns

### Branch Management Guidelines

The TuneMantra development Arnav Raj follows these guidelines for branch management:

#### Branch Creation

1. **Feature Branches**:
   - Create from: `develop` or domain-specific development branch
   - Naming: `feature/feature-name` or `domain/feature-name`
   - Owner: Feature developer or Arnav Raj
   - Lifetime: Until feature is complete and merged

2. **Bugfix Branches**:
   - Create from: `develop` or specific release branch
   - Naming: `fix/issue-description`
   - Owner: Assigned developer
   - Lifetime: Until fix is verified and merged

3. **Release Branches**:
   - Create from: `develop`
   - Naming: `release/vX.Y.Z`
   - Owner: Release manager
   - Lifetime: Until next version is released

#### Pull Request Process

1. **Prerequisites**:
   - All tests must pass
   - Code must meet style guidelines
   - Documentation must be updated
   - No merge conflicts

2. **Review Requirements**:
   - Minimum 2 approvals required
   - Tech lead approval for critical components
   - Domain specialist approval for specialized areas
   - QA verification for bug fixes

3. **Merge Strategy**:
   - Features: Squash and merge
   - Bug fixes: Squash and merge
   - Release branches: Merge commit

#### Version Control Best Practices

1. **Commit Messages**:
   - Follow conventional commits format
   - Reference issue/ticket numbers
   - Be descriptive and concise
   - Include context for complex changes

2. **Branch Hygiene**:
   - Delete branches after merging
   - Rebase feature branches regularly
   - Keep branches focused on specific tasks
   - Avoid long-lived feature branches

3. **Code Review Standards**:
   - Review for functionality
   - Review for performance
   - Review for security
   - Review for maintainability
   - Review for accessibility

### Branch Naming Conventions

All mobile-related branches follow a consistent naming convention to maintain organization in the repository:

- **Main Development Branch**: `mobile-develop`
- **Feature Branches**: `mobile/feature-name`
- **Release Branches**: `mobile-release/vX.Y.Z`
- **Bugfix Branches**: `mobile/fix-issue-description`
- **Experimental Branches**: `mobile/experimental-feature-name`
- **Performance Branches**: `mobile/perf-optimization-area`
- **Refactoring Branches**: `mobile/refactor-component-name`

### Main Development Branches

These are the primary long-running branches for mobile application development:

#### mobile-develop

**Purpose**: Main development branch for all mobile application features
**Status**: Active
**Created**: 2023-11-15
**Key Contributor**: Arnav Raj

**Description**:
This is the primary development branch for mobile application features. All feature branches are merged into this branch after code review and testing. This branch serves as the integration point for all mobile development work before being promoted to release branches.

### Bugfix Branches

These branches represent specific bug fixes for the mobile application:

#### mobile/fix-offline-sync-conflict

**Purpose**: Fix data loss during conflict resolution
**Status**: Merged into `mobile-develop` on 2024-01-20
**Created**: 2024-01-18
**Created By**: Arnav Raj
**Primary Developer**: Arnav Raj

**Description**:
This branch fixed a critical issue where data could be lost during conflict resolution when synchronizing offline changes. The issue occurred when multiple users modified the same entity simultaneously, resulting in incorrect merge decisions.

**Root Cause**:
The conflict resolution algorithm was not properly considering timestamp precision, leading to incorrect "most recent change" determinations in some edge cases.

**Fix Implementation**:
- Enhanced timestamp comparison logic
- Added conflict detection for nested objects
- Implemented proper three-way merge for complex objects
- Added additional logging for conflict resolution decisions

**Affected Components**:
- Synchronization engine
- Conflict resolution system
- Local storage manager

**Testing Verification**:
- Reproduced the issue in automated tests
- Verified fix with 25 different conflict scenarios
- Validated with real-world data patterns

#### mobile/fix-authentication-timeout

**Purpose**: Fix authentication token expiration handling
**Status**: Merged into `mobile-develop` on 2024-02-05
**Created**: 2024-02-02
**Created By**: Arnav Raj
**Primary Developer**: Arnav Raj

**Description**:
This branch fixed an issue where the application would not properly handle authentication token expirations, resulting in unexpected session timeouts and authentication failures when using the app for extended periods.

**Root Cause**:
The token refresh mechanism was not properly triggered when tokens approached expiration, and the app did not handle 401 responses correctly in all API requests.

**Fix Implementation**:
- Implemented proactive token refresh before expiration
- Enhanced error handling for authentication failures
- Added automatic retry with token refresh for 401 responses
- Improved token validation logic

**Affected Components**:
- Authentication service
- API client
- Error handling middleware

**Testing Verification**:
- Simulated token expirations at various times
- Tested with accelerated token lifetimes
- Verified correct behavior with network interruptions

#### mobile/fix-memory-leak-content-browser

**Purpose**: Fix memory leak in content browser
**Status**: Merged into `mobile-develop` on 2024-02-25
**Created**: 2024-02-22
**Created By**: Arnav Raj
**Primary Developer**: Arnav Raj

**Description**:
This branch fixed a significant memory leak in the content browser component that would occur when rapidly navigating between content items, especially with media-heavy content.

**Root Cause**:
Image and media resources were not being properly released when navigating between items, and event listeners were being accumulated without cleanup.

**Fix Implementation**:
- Implemented proper resource disposal for media elements
- Added event listener cleanup in component lifecycle methods
- Optimized image caching and memory management
- Implemented lazy loading for off-screen content

**Affected Components**:
- Content browser component
- Media player components
- Image loading system

**Testing Verification**:
- Memory profiling before and after fix
- Stress testing with rapid navigation
- Long-term stability testing (48-hour continuous operation)

### Branch Management Guidelines

The TuneMantra mobile development Arnav Raj follows these guidelines for branch management:

#### Branch Creation

1. **Feature Branches**:
   - Create from: `mobile-develop`
   - Naming: `mobile/feature-name`
   - Owner: Feature developer
   - Lifetime: Until feature is complete and merged

2. **Bugfix Branches**:
   - Create from: `mobile-develop` or specific release branch
   - Naming: `mobile/fix-issue-description`
   - Owner: Assigned developer
   - Lifetime: Until fix is verified and merged

3. **Release Branches**:
   - Create from: `mobile-develop`
   - Naming: `mobile-release/vX.Y.Z`
   - Owner: Release manager
   - Lifetime: Until next version is released

#### Pull Request Process

1. **Prerequisites**:
   - All tests must pass
   - Code must meet style guidelines
   - Documentation must be updated
   - No merge conflicts

2. **Review Requirements**:
   - Minimum 2 approvals required
   - Tech lead approval for critical components
   - UX designer approval for UI changes
   - QA verification for bug fixes

3. **Merge Strategy**:
   - Features: Squash and merge
   - Bug fixes: Squash and merge
   - Release branches: Merge commit

#### Version Control Best Practices

1. **Commit Messages**:
   - Follow conventional commits format
   - Reference issue/ticket numbers
   - Be descriptive and concise

2. **Branch Hygiene**:
   - Delete branches after merging
   - Rebase feature branches regularly
   - Keep branches focused on specific tasks

3. **Code Review Standards**:
   - Review for functionality
   - Review for performance
   - Review for security
   - Review for maintainability

### Critical Bug Fixes

This section highlights commits that fixed critical issues in the mobile application.

#### Data Loss During Conflict Resolution

| Date | Commit | Author | Description |
|------|--------|--------|-------------|
| 2024-01-18 | `2f6c8b4f` | Arnav Raj | Fix for offline sync conflict data loss |

**Issue Details**: 
When multiple users modified the same entity while offline, the conflict resolution system could incorrectly determine the "most recent" change due to timestamp precision issues, resulting in data loss during synchronization.

**Fix Implementation**:
- Enhanced timestamp comparison with microsecond precision
- Added conflict detection for nested object properties 
- Implemented proper three-way merge for complex objects
- Added comprehensive logging of conflict resolution decisions

**Impact**: This fix prevented potential data loss during offline synchronization, which was particularly important for collaborative features.

#### Authentication Token Expiration

| Date | Commit | Author | Description |
|------|--------|--------|-------------|
| 2024-02-05 | `3d7c9b5a` | Arnav Raj | Fix for authentication token expiration handling |

**Issue Details**:
The application would not properly handle JWT token expirations, resulting in unexpected session timeouts and authentication failures during extended usage sessions.

**Fix Implementation**:
- Implemented proactive token refresh 5 minutes before expiration
- Enhanced error handling for authentication failures across all API requests
- Added automatic retry with token refresh for 401 responses
- Improved token validation logic to check expiration before requests

**Impact**: This fix significantly improved the user experience by preventing unexpected authentication failures during active sessions.

#### Memory Leak in Content Browser

| Date | Commit | Author | Description |
|------|--------|--------|-------------|
| 2024-02-25 | `7d5c8b3a` | Arnav Raj | Fix for memory leak in content browser |

**Issue Details**:
A significant memory leak occurred in the content browser component when users rapidly navigated between content items, especially with media-heavy content. This could lead to app crashes after extended browsing sessions.

**Fix Implementation**:
- Implemented proper resource disposal for images and media elements
- Added comprehensive event listener cleanup in component lifecycle methods
- Optimized image caching and memory management with size limits
- Implemented lazy loading for off-screen content with proper unloading

**Impact**: This fix dramatically improved application stability during extended browsing sessions and prevented crashes on memory-constrained devices.

### Developer Insights

This section provides insights from key developers about significant development milestones.

#### Arnav Raj on Offline Synchronization

> "The offline synchronization system was one of my most complex implementations. I had to balance efficient data transfer with robust conflict resolution while ensuring a seamless user experience. The biggest challenge was handling conflicts in hierarchical data where changes at different levels could conflict in non-obvious ways. My solution uses a sophisticated three-way merge algorithm that preserves user intent while maintaining data integrity.
> 
> The 2f6c8b4f commit fixed a critical issue with timestamp precision that could lead to data loss in certain edge cases. I now use microsecond precision timestamps combined with device IDs to ensure proper ordering of changes, even when timestamps are close together."

#### Arnav Raj on Biometric Authentication

> "Implementing biometric authentication required careful consideration of the various platform capabilities and security models. iOS and Android have different approaches to biometric security, and I needed to create an abstraction layer that provided consistent behavior while leveraging platform-specific features.
> 
> The secure key storage implementation (3d7c9b5a) was particularly important, as it ensures that authentication credentials and encryption keys are protected by the highest level of security available on each device. I use the Keychain on iOS and the Keystore on Android, both protected by biometric authentication when available."

#### Arnav Raj on UI Redesign

> "The UI redesign was driven by extensive user feedback and usability testing. I focused on creating a component library (5d8c7b3a) that provided consistent behavior across both platforms while respecting platform-specific interaction patterns. The accessibility improvements (3f5d7c9b) were a major focus, ensuring the app is usable by everyone regardless of abilities.
> 
> The dark mode implementation (7b9c5d3f) was more complex than anticipated, as I needed to ensure that all visualizations, charts, and media content remained legible and visually appealing in both light and dark modes. I created a comprehensive theming system that applies appropriate contrast and color adjustments throughout the application."

#### Arnav Raj on Content Management

> "Developing the mobile content management features required rethinking how users interact with their content on smaller screens with potentially limited connectivity. The content browser implementation (2c5d8b3a) includes sophisticated filtering and search capabilities optimized for touch interaction, while the editing interface (7a4f6e2d) provides a streamlined experience for common editing tasks.
> 
> The memory leak fix (7d5c8b3a) was critical for ensuring stability during extended browsing sessions. I discovered that media resources weren't being properly released when navigating between items, leading to gradual memory consumption. The fix implements proper resource management and cache limits based on device capabilities."

### Branch Naming Conventions

All branches in the TuneMantra repository follow a consistent naming convention to maintain organization:

- **Main Development Branches**: `develop`, `mobile-develop`, `analytics-develop`, `blockchain-develop`
- **Feature Branches**: `feature/feature-name`, `mobile/feature-name`, `analytics/feature-name`, `blockchain/feature-name`
- **Release Branches**: `release/vX.Y.Z`, `mobile-release/vX.Y.Z`
- **Bugfix Branches**: `fix/issue-description`, `mobile/fix-issue-description`
- **Experimental Branches**: `experimental/feature-name`
- **Performance Branches**: `perf/optimization-area`
- **Refactoring Branches**: `refactor/component-name`
- **Documentation Branches**: `docs/documentation-area`

### Main Development Branches

These are the primary long-running branches for the TuneMantra platform:

#### main

**Purpose**: Production-ready codebase
**Status**: Active
**Created**: 2022-08-01
**Key Contributor**: Arnav Raj

**Description**:
This is the main branch containing the production-ready code. All releases are merged into this branch after thorough testing and verification. This branch always reflects what is currently in production.

**Protected Status**:
- Requires pull request reviews (minimum 3 approvals)
- Requires passing all CI tests
- Prevents force pushes
- Requires up-to-date branches before merging
- Requires security scan approval

**Branch Policies**:
- All merges must come from release branches or hotfix branches
- Automated deployment to production on merge
- Version tag required for all merges
- Change documentation required

#### develop

**Purpose**: Main development branch for core platform
**Status**: Active
**Created**: 2022-08-01
**Key Contributor**: Arnav Raj

**Description**:
This is the primary development branch where all feature branches for the core platform are merged after code review and testing. This branch serves as the integration point for all development work before being promoted to release branches.

**Protected Status**:
- Requires pull request reviews (minimum 2 approvals)
- Requires passing CI tests
- Prevents force pushes
- Requires up-to-date branches before merging

**Branch Policies**:
- All code must pass test suite
- Code coverage must not decrease
- Performance benchmarks must not regress
- Documentation must be updated

#### mobile-develop

**Purpose**: Main development branch for mobile application features

**Created**: 2023-11-15
**Key Contributor**: Arnav Raj

- Requires pull request reviews (minimum 2 approvals)
- Requires passing CI tests
- Prevents force pushes

- All code must pass mobile-specific test suite

#### analytics-develop

**Created**: 2023-03-20
**Key Contributor**: Arnav Raj

- Requires passing analytics-specific CI tests
- Prevents force pushes

#### blockchain-develop

### Bugfix Branches

These branches represent specific bug fixes for the TuneMantra platform:

#### fix/rights-calculation-error

**Purpose**: Fix incorrect royalty calculations
**Status**: Merged into `develop` on 2023-03-10
**Created**: 2023-03-05
**Created By**: Arnav Raj
**Primary Developer**: Arnav Raj

**Description**:
This branch fixed a critical issue where royalty calculations could be incorrect when multiple tiers of rights holders were involved. The issue occurred when cascading royalties were calculated with certain percentage configurations, resulting in incorrect final distributions.

**Root Cause**:
The royalty calculation algorithm was not properly handling nested percentage distributions, leading to rounding errors and incorrect allocation in multi-tier scenarios.

**Fix Implementation**:
- Enhanced the calculation algorithm to properly handle nested percentages
- Implemented exact decimal arithmetic for all calculations
- Added validation to ensure percentages sum correctly at each tier
- Implemented comprehensive testing with complex scenarios

**Affected Components**:
- Royalty calculation engine
- Statement generation system
- Financial reporting

**Testing Verification**:
- Reproduced the issue in automated tests
- Verified fix with 50 different royalty scenarios
- Validated against manual calculations
- Added regression tests to prevent future occurrences

#### fix/metadata-synchronization

**Purpose**: Fix metadata synchronization issues
**Status**: Merged into `develop` on 2023-07-15
**Created**: 2023-07-10
**Created By**: Arnav Raj
**Primary Developer**: Arnav Raj

**Description**:
This branch fixed an issue where metadata updates weren't properly synchronizing across all connected platforms, resulting in inconsistent metadata between TuneMantra and DSPs. In some cases, updated metadata would appear in TuneMantra but not propagate to streaming platforms.

**Root Cause**:
The metadata synchronization system was using an ineffective queueing mechanism that could drop updates during high system load, and wasn't properly tracking synchronization status across all platforms.

**Fix Implementation**:
- Redesigned the metadata synchronization queue with persistent storage
- Implemented a robust tracking system for sync status by platform
- Added automatic retry logic with exponential backoff
- Implemented a reconciliation process to detect and fix inconsistencies

**Affected Components**:
- Metadata synchronization service
- DSP integration services
- Content management system

**Testing Verification**:
- Reproduced the issue with simulated high load
- Verified successful synchronization across all platforms
- Tested recovery from simulated network failures
- Implemented continuous monitoring for sync failures

#### fix/analytics-data-discrepancy

**Purpose**: Fix discrepancies in analytics data
**Status**: Merged into `analytics-develop` on 2023-10-25
**Created**: 2023-10-20
**Created By**: Arnav Raj
**Primary Developer**: Arnav Raj

**Description**:
This branch fixed significant discrepancies between analytics data reported in TuneMantra and the data reported by DSPs. The issue affected revenue calculations, stream counts, and geographical distribution statistics.

**Root Cause**:
The data ingestion pipeline was incorrectly normalizing data from different sources, applying inconsistent timezone conversions, and failing to properly deduplicate data from platforms that provide overlapping reports.

**Fix Implementation**:
- Standardized all timestamp handling with UTC normalization
- Implemented robust deduplication based on platform-specific identifiers
- Created source-specific data transformation rules
- Added validation checks against source data
- Implemented reconciliation reporting

**Affected Components**:
- Analytics data ingestion pipeline
- Data normalization services
- Reporting engine

**Testing Verification**:
- Verified against historical data from multiple DSPs
- Implemented automated discrepancy detection
- Created regression test suite with known edge cases
- Added end-to-end validation for the complete pipeline

#### mobile/fix-offline-sync-conflict

**Purpose**: Fix data loss during conflict resolution
**Status**: Merged into `mobile-develop` on 2024-01-20
**Created**: 2024-01-18
**Created By**: Arnav Raj
**Primary Developer**: Arnav Raj

**Description**:
This branch fixed a critical issue where data could be lost during conflict resolution when synchronizing offline changes. The issue occurred when multiple users modified the same entity simultaneously, resulting in incorrect merge decisions.

**Root Cause**:
The conflict resolution algorithm was not properly considering timestamp precision, leading to incorrect "most recent change" determinations in some edge cases.

**Fix Implementation**:
- Enhanced timestamp comparison logic
- Added conflict detection for nested objects
- Implemented proper three-way merge for complex objects
- Added additional logging for conflict resolution decisions

**Affected Components**:
- Synchronization engine
- Conflict resolution system
- Local storage manager

**Testing Verification**:
- Reproduced the issue in automated tests
- Verified fix with 25 different conflict scenarios
- Validated with real-world data patterns

#### fix/security-vulnerability-auth

**Purpose**: Fix authentication security vulnerability
**Status**: Merged into `develop` on 2024-02-05
**Created**: 2024-02-03
**Created By**: Arnav Raj
**Primary Developer**: Arnav Raj, Security Consultant

**Description**:
This branch fixed a critical security vulnerability in the authentication system that could potentially allow session hijacking under specific circumstances. The vulnerability was discovered during a routine security audit.

**Root Cause**:
The session management system was not properly binding sessions to client fingerprints, and token refresh mechanisms didn't validate the original authentication context.

**Fix Implementation**:
- Implemented client fingerprinting for session binding
- Enhanced token refresh security with context validation
- Added additional session validation on sensitive operations
- Implemented immediate session invalidation capabilities
- Added comprehensive audit logging for authentication events

**Affected Components**:
- Authentication service
- Session management system
- Token generation and validation
- Security audit logging

**Testing Verification**:
- Security penetration testing before and after fix
- Automated security scanning
- Session validation across multiple scenarios
- Verified audit logging functionality

### Branch Management Guidelines

The TuneMantra development Arnav Raj follows these guidelines for branch management:

#### Branch Creation

1. **Feature Branches**:
   - Create from: `develop`, `mobile-develop`, `analytics-develop`, or `blockchain-develop`
   - Naming: `feature/feature-name`, `mobile/feature-name`, etc.
   - Owner: Feature developer
   - Lifetime: Until feature is complete and merged

2. **Bugfix Branches**:
   - Create from: Appropriate development branch or specific release branch
   - Naming: `fix/issue-description`, `mobile/fix-issue-description`, etc.
   - Owner: Assigned developer
   - Lifetime: Until fix is verified and merged

3. **Release Branches**:
   - Create from: Appropriate development branch
   - Naming: `release/vX.Y.Z`, `mobile-release/vX.Y.Z`, etc.
   - Owner: Release manager
   - Lifetime: Until next version is released

4. **Experimental Branches**:
   - Create from: Appropriate development branch
   - Naming: `experimental/feature-name`
   - Owner: Experiment developer
   - Lifetime: Until experiment is either incorporated or abandoned

#### Pull Request Process

1. **Prerequisites**:
   - All tests must pass
   - Code must meet style guidelines
   - Documentation must be updated
   - No merge conflicts

2. **Review Requirements**:
   - Minimum 2 approvals required (3 for production branches)
   - Tech lead approval for critical components
   - Security review for authentication and payment features
   - UX designer approval for UI changes
   - QA verification for bug fixes

3. **Merge Strategy**:
   - Features: Squash and merge
   - Bug fixes: Squash and merge
   - Release branches: Merge commit
   - Hotfixes: Cherry-pick to multiple branches

#### Version Control Best Practices

1. **Commit Messages**:
   - Follow conventional commits format
   - Reference issue/ticket numbers
   - Be descriptive and concise
   - Include scope of changes

2. **Branch Hygiene**:
   - Delete branches after merging
   - Rebase feature branches regularly
   - Keep branches focused on specific tasks
   - Limit branch lifetime to avoid drift

3. **Code Review Standards**:
   - Review for functionality
   - Review for performance
   - Review for security
   - Review for maintainability
   - Review for accessibility

4. **Continuous Integration**:
   - Run automated tests on all branches
   - Perform static code analysis
   - Check for security vulnerabilities
   - Verify build integrity
   - Generate documentation

## KYC Verification System

## KYC Verification System

This document describes the Know Your Customer (KYC) verification system implemented in TuneMantra to ensure compliance with legal requirements and prevent fraud.

### Overview

The KYC verification system validates the identity of users, particularly for financial transactions and copyright claims. It ensures that users are who they claim to be, which is crucial for:

1. Royalty payments
2. Copyright registration
3. Tax reporting
4. Legal compliance
5. Fraud prevention

### Verification Levels

TuneMantra implements a tiered verification approach:

#### Level 1: Basic Verification
- Email verification
- Phone number verification
- Basic profile information

**Required for**: Creating an account, uploading content

#### Level 2: Identity Verification
- Government-issued ID validation
- Address verification
- Tax identification (where applicable)

**Required for**: Receiving royalty payments, content distribution

#### Level 3: Enhanced Verification
- Business registration documents (for labels)
- Proof of rights ownership
- Banking information validation
- Contract verification

**Required for**: Label accounts, high-value transactions, white-label services

### Verification Process

#### User Flow

1. **Registration**
   - User creates account
   - Email verification is sent
   - Phone verification (SMS code)

2. **Document Submission**
   - Upload government ID (passport, driver's license, national ID)
   - Upload proof of address (utility bill, bank statement)
   - Selfie with ID for biometric verification

3. **Verification Review**
   - Automated checks using OCR and AI
   - Manual review by compliance team for edge cases
   - Background checks as required

4. **Approval or Rejection**
   - If approved, user account is upgraded
   - If rejected, detailed reason provided

#### System Components

##### Document Collection
- Secure file upload system
- Document type classification
- Encrypted storage
- Data retention policies

##### Automated Verification
- OCR for document text extraction
- Face recognition for ID matching
- Address verification via postal database
- Business registry API integration

##### Manual Review System
- Staff verification dashboard
- Document annotation tools
- Verification workflow management
- Compliance checklist

### Technical Implementation

#### Database Schema

The verification system uses these key tables:

```typescript
// User verification status
interface VerificationStatus {
  userId: number;
  level1Verified: boolean;
  level2Verified: boolean;
  level3Verified: boolean;
  lastVerifiedDate: Date | null;
  verificationExpiry: Date | null;
}

// Verification documents
interface VerificationDocument {
  id: number;
  userId: number;
  documentType: 'id' | 'address' | 'business' | 'tax' | 'bank' | 'other';
  documentSubtype: string;
  documentNumber: string | null;
  issueDate: Date | null;
  expiryDate: Date | null;
  issueCountry: string | null;
  verificationStatus: 'pending' | 'verified' | 'rejected';
  rejectionReason: string | null;
  uploadDate: Date;
  verifiedDate: Date | null;
  verifiedBy: number | null; // Staff ID
}
```

#### API Endpoints

##### User-facing Endpoints
- `GET /api/verification/status` - Check current verification status
- `POST /api/verification/documents` - Upload verification documents
- `GET /api/verification/requirements` - Get requirements based on user type

##### Admin Endpoints
- `GET /api/admin/verification/queue` - View verification queue
- `GET /api/admin/verification/user/:id` - View user verification details
- `PATCH /api/admin/verification/document/:id` - Update document verification
- `POST /api/admin/verification/user/:id/verify` - Complete verification for user

### Security Measures

#### Data Protection
- All verification documents are encrypted at rest
- Personally Identifiable Information (PII) is stored separately
- Document access is logged and audited
- Compliance with GDPR, CCPA, and other data protection regulations

#### Fraud Prevention
- IP location verification
- Device fingerprinting
- Behavioral analysis
- Document tampering detection
- Duplicate detection across accounts

### Compliance Requirements

#### Regional Variations

The system adapts verification requirements based on:
- User's country of residence
- Distribution territories
- Payment jurisdictions
- Local regulatory requirements

#### Periodic Re-verification

To maintain compliance:
- Level 2 verification expires after 2 years
- Level 3 verification expires after 1 year
- Changes to critical account information trigger re-verification

### Integration with Platform Features

#### Payment Processing
- Verified identity required for payment account linking
- Verification level determines payment limits
- Tax information validated for proper withholding

#### Rights Management
- Copyright claims require identity verification
- Rights transfers require enhanced verification
- Dispute resolution linked to verification status

#### Label Management
- Label account creation requires business verification
- Artist roster management requires rights verification
- Sub-label creation requires enhanced verification

### Metrics and Reporting

#### Key Performance Indicators
- Verification completion rate
- Average verification time
- Rejection rate and reasons
- Verification level distribution
- Regional verification statistics

#### Compliance Reporting
- Verification audit trail
- Regulatory compliance reports
- Suspicious activity reporting
- Document retention compliance

### Future Enhancements

Planned improvements to the verification system:

1. **AI-powered Verification**: Enhanced document validation using advanced AI
2. **Biometric Verification**: Additional biometric options for identity validation
3. **Blockchain Verification**: Decentralized identity verification options
4. **API Integrations**: Third-party verification service integrations
5. **Real-time Verification**: Instant verification for supported documents and regions

## TuneMantra Quick Start Guide (2)

## TuneMantra Quick Start Guide

This quick start guide covers the essential operations for using the TuneMantra platform.

### Account Setup

#### Registration
1. Navigate to the registration page
2. Select your account type (Artist, Label, or Distributor)
3. Enter your account details (name, email, password)
4. Complete the verification process
5. Set up your profile details

#### Profile Configuration
1. Upload your profile image
2. Add your biography and social media links
3. Configure notification preferences
4. Set up your payment information
5. Complete KYC verification if required

### Music Distribution

#### Creating a Track
1. Navigate to "Tracks" in the main menu
2. Click "Add New Track"
3. Upload your audio file (supported formats: MP3, WAV, FLAC)
4. Fill in the track metadata:
   - Title
   - Artists (primary and featured)
   - Composers and producers
   - Lyrics (if applicable)
   - Genre and mood tags
   - Release date
5. Configure track-specific settings
6. Save the track

#### Creating a Release
1. Navigate to "Releases" in the main menu
2. Click "Create New Release"
3. Select the release type (Single, EP, Album)
4. Upload cover artwork (minimum 3000x3000 pixels, JPG/PNG format)
5. Add tracks to the release:
   - Select from your existing tracks, or
   - Create new tracks within the release creation flow
6. Set the release metadata:
   - Title
   - Primary artist
   - Release date
   - Pre-release date (if applicable)
   - Genre information
   - Copyright information
7. Preview and confirm the release details

#### Distributing Your Music
1. Navigate to your release
2. Click "Distribute"
3. Select target platforms:
   - Choose individual platforms, or
   - Select platform groups (e.g., "All Major Platforms")
4. Choose distribution options:
   - Immediate distribution
   - Scheduled distribution (set a future date)
5. Review distribution details
6. Confirm and start the distribution process

#### Monitoring Distribution Status
1. Navigate to "Distribution" in the main menu
2. View the status of all distributions:
   - Pending: Distribution not yet processed
   - Processing: Distribution in progress
   - Distributed: Successfully delivered to platforms
   - Failed: Distribution encountered an error
3. For failed distributions, view error details and remediation options

### Royalty Management

#### Configuring Revenue Splits
1. Navigate to your release
2. Click "Configure Splits"
3. Add collaborators:
   - Search by email or username
   - Specify their role (composer, producer, etc.)
4. Assign percentage splits:
   - Set percentage for each collaborator
   - Total must equal 100%
5. Save split configuration

#### Viewing Royalty Reports
1. Navigate to "Royalties" in the main menu
2. View summarized earnings:
   - By track/release
   - By platform
   - By time period
3. Drill down for detailed reports:
   - Stream counts by platform
   - Revenue by territory
   - Historical performance

#### Processing Payments
1. Navigate to "Payments" in the main menu
2. View current balance and payment history
3. Request a withdrawal:
   - Enter withdrawal amount
   - Select payment method
   - Confirm withdrawal request
4. Track payment status

### Analytics

#### Viewing Performance Metrics
1. Navigate to "Analytics" in the main menu
2. View performance dashboard:
   - Total streams
   - Revenue overview
   - Platform distribution
   - Geographic breakdown
3. Filter by:
   - Date range
   - Release/track
   - Platform
   - Territory

#### Creating Custom Reports
1. Navigate to "Analytics" > "Custom Reports"
2. Select report type
3. Choose metrics to include
4. Set filters and parameters
5. Generate and export report

### Account Management

#### Managing API Keys
1. Navigate to "Account" > "API Keys"
2. View existing API keys
3. Create a new API key:
   - Enter key name
   - Select permissions
   - Set expiration (optional)
4. Revoke existing keys as needed

#### Managing Team Members (Label Accounts)
1. Navigate to "Team Management"
2. View existing team members
3. Add a new team member:
   - Enter email address
   - Assign role and permissions
   - Send invitation
4. Modify existing team member permissions

### Support

#### Creating Support Tickets
1. Navigate to "Support" in the main menu
2. Click "New Ticket"
3. Select issue category
4. Enter ticket details:
   - Title
   - Description
   - Attachments (if needed)
5. Submit the ticket and track its status

For more detailed instructions, please refer to the full user guides in the documentation.
